All my data and results will be made available to IAR who I will be collaborating with and an official report will be given to them with any recommendations that this research results in. This is to ensure that my research will not simply be a theoretical document, but a practical piece of literature that will be available to the people working closest with these animals to keep them safe. 

(Young Orangutan Sitting By Mom by Erik Kilby. Used under CC BY 2.0)
I am aiming to raise these funds to pay for my transportation, accommodation, vaccines, visas,  and  some gear that I will be taking into the field with me. In return I can promise email updates to anyone who is interested in hearing about my trip. Every bit helps so please give even a buck if you can! If not, that's cool! But please please share this with anyone and everyone! 

(Other images used: Baby Orangutan by Ellen Munro  and baby orang oetan by belgianchocolate. Both used under CC BY 2.0)

story:
ECO COURAGEOUS
EDUCATION CREATIONS

"When our lights fail we'll count stars.

When our aquifers empty, we'll drink love. 

It'll probably be tomorrow morning,

I would wake up early just in case." 

- from "Waiting For Things To Get Worse"


                         

                           



Our worlds are changing so fast! Seems like each day brings more drastic news. As we learn to integrate each new change facing our generation on the planet - environmental, cultural, political, technological, and spiritual  thresholds all arriving at the same time - it's a lot of transformation to imagine going through.

How's it all been going for you? How is your home shifting - or not - with the times? The choices we make around the planet THIS DECADE will touch generations to come, affect vital limbs of earthly life. But we're waiting, held down, overwhelmed, met with our most intense feelings - despair, dread, rage, guilt, shame - and so we understandably numb out, turn away again. The world is too much.

Because encouraging humanity
to focus on climate change requires 
creative education, 
regenerative spaces, 
and radical art ~ 

Eco Courageous Education Creations
are currently creating CURRICULUM ~
offering three branches of engagement,
which you can support today ~


EVENTS * MEDIA MAKING * ART-ACTIVISM


ECEC is currently creating eco-curriculum ~ offering conscious, compassionate, fun, and often seriously funny educational ecological experiences.

We share skills around ecological reconnection and resilience, practice placemaking and peacemaking, and expand our connections through outdoor immersions, art, music, movement, and media making. 

Importantly, we also set safe space for holding and processing what may show up as difficult, intense, frightening, or numbed feelings for our rapidly changing homescapes. 

We mean home to include both house and town, body and bioregion, family and planet. We appreciate different scales and perspectives. And we give special consideration to solastalgia - the homesickness experienced as our homes disappear around us.

Right now Eco Courageous work needs your help - to encourage more communities, children and adults, to share skills for facing our climate challenges creatively and courageously - via concrete steps that catalyze collaborations, inspire climate confidence, and strengthen solidarities.

The specific projects supported through this campaign are a new album of music, a video series, and ecocourageous events and workshops. See video updates above, or text below, for more details.


                                        NEW PRESS!

Town Topics: Princeton Native Joshua Halpern Has Unique Approach to Climate Crisis

Hub Oakland: Transforming Home Together: Solastalgia, Solidarity, and Silliness


MORE TESTIMONIALS HERE


DETAILS, BUDGET, PERKS,
and EXPERIENCE AVAILABLE BELOW

 ~ or at ecocourageous.com



EVENTS


EVENTS include: Council and Consultation, Classes and Workshops, Forums and Cafes, Immersions and Tours.

  • LEARN and SHARE SKILLS for ecological reconnection, resilience, and courage.
  • HONOR our experiences of climate numbness or despair, denial or dread, and especially SOLASTALGIA - the homesickness felt as our homes disappear around us.
  • FOSTER IMAGINATION, grow gratitudes, and cultivate creativity for community climate challenges.
  • PRACTICE PLACEPLAYING for transforming our
    homescapes together.




Upcoming Events (Dates Soon): 
* Climate Fear Cafes
* Witnessing Water: Mokelumne River East Bay Water Tours
More workshop details at: ecocourageous.com/workshopsevents


MEDIA MAKING


MEDIA MAKING includes: Videos and Films, Photos and Poetry, Articles, and Books

Communities around the globe weave the cycles of life and death into their place on the body of earth, as they have for generations.

Joshua Halpern, the founder of Eco Courageous Education Creations, has traveled around the world, from Hawaii to the Himalayas, sharing stories from small family farms and community cultivated sacred sites, honoring ancestral dynamics still alive and vital.

Explore Josh's body of work, decades of multimedia explorations, at outsidejosh.com, and as more educators and art activists collaborate, they'll become available through ecocourageous.com. Producing media that feels aligned? Get in touch, we'd love to feature you!




ART-ACTIVISM


ARTIVISM includes: Music, Dance, Performance, Theater, Placeplay

CURRENT PROJECT: ANY TIME NOW PEOPLE 

AN ALBUM OF SONGS AND MUSIC VIDEOS FROM HOME HOWLS


Home Howls produces seriously funny climate justice imaginings, live looped into unexpectedly sexy beats, sometimes costumed as future animals, or nuclear meltdowns, or galactic supercluster starsheds, making for astonishing live performances. 

Ok, Home Howls is still all Josh so far, looping his voice and adding each instrument himself live, including drums, guitar, even glockenspeil. This campaign continues the expansion of Josh's environminstrel/edge-jester musical horizons by supporting the creation of a new band, recording an album's worth of music, and completing music videos Josh and his generous friends have already begun.

Home Howls and a rotating crew of friends spent every Friday in June 2014 filming at stunning locations around the Bay, where the confluence of local and global ecologies are transforming most rapidly, most beautifully, or most worryingly. With this campaign, we will be able to start up filming again for JULY 2015!



WHAT YOU'RE $UPPORTING:

Joshua Halpern, MA (bio below) works for a Bay Area Honey Farm and for the last five years has been offering his eco educational art and teachings ~ in the lineage of his teacher and neighbor Joanna Macy's Work that Reconnects ~ as gifts, for free. Now he's poised to expand on some huge collaborations ~ but there are several next steps that are out of Josh's reach as a honey vendor. 

This campaign is an opportunity for you to support both the steps necessary for Josh's next specific projects to blossom (currently an album of music, a video series, and teaching events) as well as expanding the world of Eco Courageous collaborations and exchanges between both biologically and culturally diverse communities.


  • $14,000 - Any Time Now People - Home Howls Video Series 
    Short videos have become a language we all speak, and are one of the primary branches of Eco Courageous Education Creations. We have a series of videos planned touring transformational ecology sites around the world.

    Putting climate catastrophe questions to sexy funny beats on a tour of gorgeously transforming Bay Area sacred ecology sites, Josh Halpern has already created hours of beautiful content, just with the help of his phenomenal friends, the beauty of the shifting landscape, and almost no money whatsoever.

    The videos - part musical celebration, part environmental education - are ready! Ready for (rather than Josh filling all of these roles) more amazing talent, locations,     costumes, camera and sound crew, with all the professionals needed for production and postproduction - an editor, an animator, an effects person - all to pay fairly, and then produce and publish and share together, as widely as possible!
  • $9,000 - Any Time Now People - Home Howls Album: Music videos depend on beautifully recorded music, which means getting Josh out of his house. This covers the costs of recording a 12 song album for an independent artist: recording, musician fees, mixing/mastering, production, design, printing, distribution, etc.

  • $3,000 - Training Fees - To improve Josh's skills and resources as an educational facilitator, as well as to connect with other eco-artist-activists and communities, Josh will further explore The Work That Reconnects with Joanna Macy, take courses on planetary hospice with Stephen Jenkinson's Orphan Wisdom School, learn Ecology of Leadership with James Stark, pursue Justice And Ecology Training with Occidental Arts and Ecology Center, commit to vocal trainings for the music, and Wilderness First Aid Certifications for the nature immersions  ~ with fees ranging from $250 to $1500.

  • $2,400 - SONY NEX-VG30 Camera: An exceptional video camera (huge sensor, interchangeable lenses) for taking Eco Courageous media making to the next outstanding levels.

  • $650 - K8 1000 Watt Speaker - Live Performances: All of Home Howls songs so far have come through a sweet but tiny box amp. Each show has featured one or two folks with the feedback "I couldn't hear all your words." We're gonna make sure you all hear all the words!

  • $500 Workshop Expansion Budget: Covers initial space fees, promotional items, food and transportation, website upgrades.

  • $150 - Mini Keyboard and MIDI controller: For expanding the range of howls.

  • $150 - Effects Pedal: How we can be affective without effects??

  • $150 - A Decent Microphone: So you can clearly hear our ecologies transforming!

Which adds up exactly to a $30,000 campaign, and then if we add the 10% that Indiegogo takes off, brings us to $33,000. Any funds received over this mark will be put towards increasing the depth and breadth of Eco Courageous Education Creations by developing: 

a kids CURRICULUM, more TOURS, a traveling ROADSHOW, a television SERIES, and more creative collaborations!

Each of us learn to hold and share our experiences of the shifting planet at our own pace. Joining each other in common concern with honesty, humor, gratitude and courage opens supportive and imaginative healing space for solidarity and skill-sharing. You can help these creative courageous blossoms bloom.


Face your future! We have some ecoGORRRgeous PERKS!!!


NEW OFFERINGS:


JOCELYN JACKSON, founder & nourisher at JUSTUS Kitchen ~ creating liberation and love with every meal ~ is graciously offering us FOUR outstanding perk options for savoring our sacred connections through food.

Bakers Dozen of Customized Organic Cookies ($30) Jocelyn will call on the bounty of the season and your favorite sweet experiences to create a cookie recipe just for you.  Included in the gift box is a handwritten recipe card to recreate your customized cookies at home.

Recycled Denim and African Textile Apron ($70) Jocelyn will make and send you one of her recycled denim aprons with African textile accents. She'll also include a seasonal recipe to try out the first time you wear it.

Seasonal Organic Dinner for Two ($100) Jocelyn loves love and will make a seasonal 4 course meal for you and someone you hold dear to enjoy.  She'll also bring a brassicas bouquet, candle light, and a poem honoring our deep connection to the story of food and one another.


Customized Cooking Class & Seasonal Organic Dinner for Two ($275) Jocelyn agrees with the saying, "Cooking with love provides food for the soul."  She looks forward to joining you at the hearth to bring the love letters between cooks she calls recipes to life.  You will get to select a technique and a world cuisine to focus on during the 2 hour class. She'll leave you to enjoy your 4 course dinner with a brassicas bouquet, candle light, and a poem honoring our deep connection to the story of food and one another.

Dinners are limited to Bay Area locals, but we can send you cookies and aprons anywhere! Deep deep gratitude to Jocelyn for all the sustenance she cooks up for communities near and far, and for her generosity to this campaign. Yum yum yum!

OFFER EXPIRED:

Courageous Creativity: The Work that Reconnects, Wildness, and Music as Medicine Workshop

Lydia Harutoonian M.A., Penny Livingston M.A., and members of the musical group Rising Appalachia, Leah Song and Chloe Smith will guide us through a deep experience on the land, exploring the connections between negotiating the realities of our time, music as medicine, and reconnecting to the wild. Joanna Macy Ph.D will offer a special teaching Wednesday morning.

Lydia will be our main guide in the Work that Reconnects, Penny will guide us in observing and listening with the land, Leah and Chloe will lead us in Global Sound Movement work as we engage in the profound teachings of the Work That Reconnects, and Joanna will offer us a teaching around empowerment, trust, and deep time. There will be a private concert on Tuesday night with Leah, Chloe and special guests that will be open to the local community. 

Support these amazing teachers and Eco Courageous Education Creations at the same time! Enrollment has filled up fast, but we have ONE SPOT WAITING for YOU if you grab this perk. Join us for these powerful two days ~ June 2nd and 3rd, 2015, at Commonweal Garden in Bolinas, California.

More details here!

SCOOP THIS UP TODAY! But also, if you don't get to scoop this one, don't worry! We've got plenty of perks to go around! Like...

                            

                                 
                                PHOTO BOOKS

                                            4 different books! 4 different sizes! 
                                                                   Choose from:

Ecospiritual Selfies                                                                                                             MystiCali

   


Share the Sacred                                                                                                           and 12.21.12

   


with MORE BOOKS of photos and POETRY becoming available over the course of this campaign!

                   2015 or 2016 CALENDARS:  $222

                                                            Choose from:

Groves                                                     Friends that Food                   Fitting Into the Infinite


                                                        PHOTO PRINTS
                                   Choose from 12 Different Prints Here

                                                 
                                                 High Quality Digital Copy: $8

                                          Smaller High Quality Physical Print: $18

                                         Medium High Quality Physical Print:  $45

                              Large Poster Sized High Quality Physical Print: $165


ANY TIME NOW PEOPLE
~THE ALBUM~

                          

                    

                                                    ARRIVING LATER THIS YEAR!


ALBUM MP3 Download: $14 - Get the album first, as soon as it's ready.

CD: $20 - Buy the physical CD, like, for CD players.

VINYL: $88 - limited edition vinyl, you know who you are.

              OTHER SPECIAL PERKS: 


$110: Be in our music video! Home Howls will be filming in stunning locations around the bay where the ecology is transforming most rapidly. (If you're local) come play with us! If you're not local, there'll be opportunities for you to be in a video too! Coming soon!

                                   

$120 Haircut Josh will cut your hair. It's something Josh loves doing and is actually really skillful at. You can ask any of his previous haircuttees. The only bad haircut he ever gave was to his Brooklyn housemate who insisted Josh cut his hair by candlelight, listening to opera on full volume. Josh will make sure we have enough light to see what's hairpening.

                                           

$145: Consultations For individuals, partners, houses and communities - how are the changes around us affecting your life now and your expectations for life in the future? Josh will offer a 90 min conscious, compassionate holding of the hardest parts and reassuring support for transformational imagination and agency around these challenging questions.

                                         

$650: Design Your Own ECEC Workshop Josh will design an Eco Courageous workshop to meet your community's needs. That could mean so many things. Let's discuss!

More Perks Arriving Weekly...



ROOTS AND ORIGINS


The art and teachings carried inside this Eco Courageous basket, while gratefully held in supportive community, have so far remained solely the soul expression of 33 year old Joshua Halpern, MA,  in the direct lineage of Josh's neighbor and teacher Joanna Macy, who has stood for six decades as one of the greatest living guides for healing the woundings of our planet.



Josh has been sharing sacred earthly relationships through art for over two decades, with a special sensitivity to the relationships that accompany transforming home. Josh was born and raised at the confluence of the Matawan and Wopowog Rivers in Princeton NJ, the son of two professors committed to both the journeys of the soul and the achievement of justice on the planet. Josh grew up playing in his father's garden and in the woods by the river, loving writing, music, and photography from a young age. He received a BFA in Film/Television from NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts in 2004.

While in school, Josh’s father Manfred died, and Josh spent the next several years making art unfolding his family’s reactions to this loss. A few of these works can be found here. Having discovered a great deal about his roots, Josh turned his attention to stories outside of himself, launched outsidejosh.com, and went WWOOFing - traveling around the world for 9 months in 2007, lending a hand on organic farms in Hawaii, the Philippines, Thailand, and India. Josh’s film about this journey WWOOF ‘n Wander (53 mins) is streaming here in seven parts.



Upon returning to his home hemisphere, Josh worked for three years as the Organic Produce Coordinator for the best natural food store in New Jersey, the Whole Earth Center, deepening his connection with local food and food justice, and helping his mother vacate the house his family had called home for 50 years.


Working with his heart and hands, helping tend close relationships between people and soil, Josh began to recognize planetary forces interconnecting within the choices available to neighborhoods on the ground. He became moved to really study all the strands - what's unravelling and what's weaving together around us - and add more minds to his mix of understanding.

So in 2010 Josh moved to the Bay Area to pursue a masters degree at the California Institute of Integral Studies, studying with a community of deeply caring and conscious cross-pollinating scholars, healers and activists, receiving his MA in Integral Ecologies in 2013.


Integral Ecologists help communities and individuals regenerate mutually enhancing relationships with the Earth. This can cover a range of earthly scales - from building local systems to perpetuate what's precious to different communities - to attending to the needs of families whose homes can no longer hold them, falling into the already staggering numbers of climate-based refugees around the world. Josh doesn't have anywhere near all the answers, but in consultation work, teaching events, and creative placeplaying, he cultivates a steady ability to hold and share the questions, and integrates great diversities of perspective for deeply crucial choices, drawing from different directions depending on the details, including ~


         ~ ecopsychology
~ expressive arts therapy 
          ~nature based healing modalities
                     somatics ~
                                                                                                                        ~ permaculture                                                                                                      ~ transition town initiatives
                                                                                               growing food as medicine~
                                                                                       ~regenerative design
                                                                                 ~integrative health
                up-to-date climate science ~
     ~ planetary biologies
cosmology ~
       ~ quantum physics                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                deep ecology ~
                                                                                                                                 ~ ecofeminism 
                                                                                                           environmental ethics ~ 
                                                                                 ~ the spectrum of ecological humanities

                  ~  indigenous wisdom traditions
                                    ~ cross-cultural spiritual understandings
                                                  ~ immanent place-based ceremonies


                                              ~ the responsibilities of 
                                                     shared solidarities in the 
                                                      continuing struggles 
                                                          for peace and 
                                                            health and
                                                              justice.



While not creating educational art, Josh juuuuuuust gets by selling local raw honey at farmers markets all over the Bay Area for Marshall's Honey Farm, and he loves this job - the opportunity to trade fresh food with neighbors, talk about how the bees are doing, track how the drought's affecting his farmer friends at the market. 


So far, Josh has continued to offer almost of all of the creative eco-educational art and teaching he's developed for free, as gifts to the communities he loves and is concerned for. Josh trusts this work has become the confluence of his life's rivers, and he sees helping folks deal with the changing planet as his life's work - far beyond this campaign and even beyond the places he currently wishes to hold as home. It would be helpful for this commitment to generate a livable income while the world changes and our work ramps up, but Josh will continue to show up as a bridge between generations, however strong the winds on the bridge may blow. Crowd-funding allows for the grounded and realizable steps to build this commitment to the levels where fruitful collaborations become inevitable.


 

Josh is currently calling himself a Metamorphosis Ecologist (though you can call him whatever you want.) He feels this sounds poetic and honors the imaginal cells in the dying caterpillars that transform into butterflies. Most folks will not have met a Metamorphosis Ecologist before, or even want to. Josh messes up plans by truth telling. But he's learned to shake people up lovingly, and for some time he's been able to cultivate a life where community really supports and encourages new ways of relating. And there are generations of learning ahead of us. Healing relationships with the transforming earth is, as they say, a "growth industry".

Testimonials here



Challenges and Potentials

Indiegogo encourages us to be forthright with challenges our projects might face. There are personal and political challenges to the work Eco Courageous Education Creations have planned here.


Josh is deeply committed to providing avenues where silenced voices (the oppressed, the near extinct, the magical) can sing, places where each of our neighbors is welcomed in wholeness. He is driven to make a real difference in healing people's relationships with their home. So it doesn't always feel clear how dancing in disappearing marshes, or dressing up as future animals helps anyone directly. This is a very important question for each of us. What does help? Josh is really curious. Some aspects of our lives change too quickly, others agonizingly slow. No matter what we might do, it gets grim sometimes. There's truth in that hopelessness. But doom and gloom don't inspire, won't ignite anyone's passion or agency. We each know the ways we try to help or hold back the tide. But holding and sharing our shifting worlds also seems to require letting in increasing amounts of unbearable information and persisting with courage towards what seems impossible.


This reveals one of our main gifts of this moment - the challenge of embracing radical uncertainty. As Joanna Macy says, "If anyone tells you they know how it's going to turn out, don't believe them!" When facing the deepest unknowns we've collectively encountered, doesn't it help to feel held in the supportive arms of a rapidly expanding community of eco-activist souls rising in love and defense of the planet? We're moving through and beyond our individual separate stories, into strategies and solutions that include all of us. Supporting creativity and courage, mixing humor into our heartbreak, we learn to hold and share this sacred home together, and we imagine and commit to all the healing our particular place and position provides.

Thank you for doing everything you can today! Our brightest lights, currently throwing themselves into these climate questions, having reached the effectiveness limits of graphs and charts and lectures, all continue to call out for alternative educational models, and for radical art.


This is what Josh, through his body and soul, is able to offer today. You can help him continue bringing these offerings to the world. Josh releases expectations that Eco Courageous Education Creations will save civilization or rescue the functioning biosphere. But every chance he gets, Josh very much wants to support honesty, humor, healing, gratitude, generosity, inspiration, imagination, curiosity, and courage ~ as we unfurl our future together.

Or, as the poet Rainer Maria Rilke comes through Joanna Macy's translation, to "love the things as no one has thought to love them":

Dear darkening ground,
you've endured so patiently the walls we've built,
perhaps you'll give the cities one more hour
and grant the churches and cloisters two.

And those that labor—let their work
grip them another five hours, or seven,
before you become forest again, and water, and widening wilderness
in that hour of inconceivable terror
when you take back your name
from all things.

Just give me a little more time!
I want to love the things
as no one has thought to love them,
until they're worthy of you and real.
- Book of Hours, I 61


Other Ways You Can Help

Deep gratitude for sharing this moment together, and of course not everyone is able to help financially. If you'd like to collaborate with us, enliven the eco courageous community, come on down! Or we can come to you! Get in touch, joshua@ecocourageous.com, for any reason in the world. We'd love if you send us a testimonial or endorsement or blurb if you've been already moved by Josh's work. But really, everything you do that encourages courage in the face of climate change is absolutely welcome. Courage grows from our togetherness.
Eco Courageous Education Creations also has a patreon page (coming soon), as well as ecocourageous.com where you can read more details, and all shares, tweets, likes, and in person hugs are super beneficial and welcome as well.
Thanks,
Fruitful transformations!
Josh
story_txt:
ECO COURAGEOUS
EDUCATION CREATIONS


"When our lights fail we'll count stars.
When our aquifers empty, we'll drink love. 
It'll probably be tomorrow morning,
I would wake up early just in case." 
- from "Waiting For Things To Get Worse"


                                                    

Our worlds are changing so fast! Seems like each day brings more drastic news. As we learn to integrate each new change facing our generation on the planet - environmental, cultural, political, technological, and spiritual  thresholds all arriving at the same time - it's a lot of transformation to imagine going through.How's it all been going for you? How is your home shifting - or not - with the times? The choices we make around the planet THIS DECADE will touch generations to come, affect vital limbs of earthly life. But we're waiting, held down, overwhelmed, met with our most intense feelings - despair, dread, rage, guilt, shame - and so we understandably numb out, turn away again. The world is too much.
Because encouraging humanity to focus on climate change requires creative education, regenerative spaces, and radical art ~ 

Eco Courageous Education Creationsare currently creating CURRICULUM ~offering three branches of engagement, which you can support today ~


EVENTS * MEDIA MAKING * ART-ACTIVISM
ECEC is currently creating eco-curriculum ~ offering conscious, compassionate, fun, and often seriously funny educational ecological experiences.We share skills around ecological reconnection and resilience, practice placemaking and peacemaking, and expand our connections through outdoor immersions, art, music, movement, and media making. Importantly, we also set safe space for holding and processing what may show up as difficult, intense, frightening, or numbed feelings for our rapidly changing homescapes. We mean home to include both house and town, body and bioregion, family and planet. We appreciate different scales and perspectives. And we give special consideration to solastalgia - the homesickness experienced as our homes disappear around us.Right now Eco Courageous work needs your help - to encourage more communities, children and adults, to share skills for facing our climate challenges creatively and courageously - via concrete steps that catalyze collaborations, inspire climate confidence, and strengthen solidarities.The specific projects supported through this campaign are a new album of music, a video series, and ecocourageous events and workshops. See video updates above, or text below, for more details.                                        NEW PRESS!Town Topics: Princeton Native Joshua Halpern Has Unique Approach to Climate CrisisHub Oakland: Transforming Home Together: Solastalgia, Solidarity, and Silliness


MORE TESTIMONIALS HERE


DETAILS, BUDGET, PERKS, and EXPERIENCE AVAILABLE BELOW


 ~ or at ecocourageous.com



EVENTS







EVENTS include: Council and Consultation, Classes and Workshops, Forums and Cafes, Immersions and Tours.


LEARN and SHARE SKILLS for ecological reconnection, resilience, and courage.
HONOR our experiences of climate numbness or despair, denial or dread, and especially SOLASTALGIA - the homesickness felt as our homes disappear around us.

FOSTER IMAGINATION, grow gratitudes, and cultivate creativity for community climate challenges.

PRACTICE PLACEPLAYING for transforming our homescapes together.






Upcoming Events (Dates Soon): 


* Climate Fear Cafes * Witnessing Water: Mokelumne River East Bay Water Tours
More workshop details at: ecocourageous.com/workshopsevents




MEDIA MAKING





MEDIA MAKING includes: Videos and Films, Photos and Poetry, Articles, and Books

Communities around the globe weave the cycles of life and death into their place on the body of earth, as they have for generations.
Joshua Halpern, the founder of Eco Courageous Education Creations, has traveled around the world, from Hawaii to the Himalayas, sharing stories from small family farms and community cultivated sacred sites, honoring ancestral dynamics still alive and vital.
Explore Josh's body of work, decades of multimedia explorations, at outsidejosh.com, and as more educators and art activists collaborate, they'll become available through ecocourageous.com. Producing media that feels aligned? Get in touch, we'd love to feature you!



ART-ACTIVISM





ARTIVISM includes: Music, Dance, Performance, Theater, Placeplay


CURRENT PROJECT: ANY TIME NOW PEOPLE 


AN ALBUM OF SONGS AND MUSIC VIDEOS FROM HOME HOWLS

Home Howls produces seriously funny climate justice imaginings, live looped into unexpectedly sexy beats, sometimes costumed as future animals, or nuclear meltdowns, or galactic supercluster starsheds, making for astonishing live performances. 

Ok, Home Howls is still all Josh so far, looping his voice and adding each instrument himself live, including drums, guitar, even glockenspeil. This campaign continues the expansion of Josh's environminstrel/edge-jester musical horizons by supporting the creation of a new band, recording an album's worth of music, and completing music videos Josh and his generous friends have already begun.
Home Howls and a rotating crew of friends spent every Friday in June 2014 filming at stunning locations around the Bay, where the confluence of local and global ecologies are transforming most rapidly, most beautifully, or most worryingly. With this campaign, we will be able to start up filming again for JULY 2015!






WHAT YOU'RE $UPPORTING:

Joshua Halpern, MA (bio below) works for a Bay Area Honey Farm and for the last five years has been offering his eco educational art and teachings ~ in the lineage of his teacher and neighbor Joanna Macy's Work that Reconnects ~ as gifts, for free. Now he's poised to expand on some huge collaborations ~ but there are several next steps that are out of Josh's reach as a honey vendor. 
This campaign is an opportunity for you to support both the steps necessary for Josh's next specific projects to blossom (currently an album of music, a video series, and teaching events) as well as expanding the world of Eco Courageous collaborations and exchanges between both biologically and culturally diverse communities.


$14,000 - Any Time Now People - Home Howls Video Series Short videos have become a language we all speak, and are one of the primary branches of Eco Courageous Education Creations. We have a series of videos planned touring transformational ecology sites around the world.Putting climate catastrophe questions to sexy funny beats on a tour of gorgeously transforming Bay Area sacred ecology sites, Josh Halpern has already created hours of beautiful content, just with the help of his phenomenal friends, the beauty of the shifting landscape, and almost no money whatsoever. The videos - part musical celebration, part environmental education - are ready! Ready for (rather than Josh filling all of these roles) more amazing talent, locations, costumes, camera and sound crew, with all the professionals needed for production and postproduction - an editor, an animator, an effects person - all to pay fairly, and then produce and publish and share together, as widely as possible!


$9,000 - Any Time Now People - Home Howls Album: Music videos depend on beautifully recorded music, which means getting Josh out of his house. This covers the costs of recording a 12 song album for an independent artist: recording, musician fees, mixing/mastering, production, design, printing, distribution, etc.


$3,000 - Training Fees - To improve Josh's skills and resources as an educational facilitator, as well as to connect with other eco-artist-activists and communities, Josh will further explore The Work That Reconnects with Joanna Macy, take courses on planetary hospice with Stephen Jenkinson's Orphan Wisdom School, learn Ecology of Leadership with James Stark, pursue Justice And Ecology Training with Occidental Arts and Ecology Center, commit to vocal trainings for the music, and Wilderness First Aid Certifications for the nature immersions  ~ with fees ranging from $250 to $1500.


$2,400 - SONY NEX-VG30 Camera: An exceptional video camera (huge sensor, interchangeable lenses) for taking Eco Courageous media making to the next outstanding levels.


$650 - K8 1000 Watt Speaker - Live Performances: All of Home Howls songs so far have come through a sweet but tiny box amp. Each show has featured one or two folks with the feedback "I couldn't hear all your words." We're gonna make sure you all hear all the words!


$500 Workshop Expansion Budget: Covers initial space fees, promotional items, food and transportation, website upgrades.


$150 - Mini Keyboard and MIDI controller: For expanding the range of howls.


$150 - Effects Pedal: How we can be affective without effects??


$150 - A Decent Microphone: So you can clearly hear our ecologies transforming!


Which adds up exactly to a $30,000 campaign, and then if we add the 10% that Indiegogo takes off, brings us to $33,000. Any funds received over this mark will be put towards increasing the depth and breadth of Eco Courageous Education Creations by developing: 
a kids CURRICULUM, more TOURS, a traveling ROADSHOW, a television SERIES, and more creative collaborations!
Each of us learn to hold and share our experiences of the shifting planet at our own pace. Joining each other in common concern with honesty, humor, gratitude and courage opens supportive and imaginative healing space for solidarity and skill-sharing. You can help these creative courageous blossoms bloom.

Face your future! We have some ecoGORRRgeous PERKS!!!


NEW OFFERINGS:


JOCELYN JACKSON, founder & nourisher at JUSTUS Kitchen ~ creating liberation and love with every meal ~ is graciously offering us FOUR outstanding perk options for savoring our sacred connections through food.

Bakers Dozen of Customized Organic Cookies ($30) Jocelyn will call on the bounty of the season and your favorite sweet experiences to create a cookie recipe just for you.  Included in the gift box is a handwritten recipe card to recreate your customized cookies at home.
Recycled Denim and African Textile Apron ($70) Jocelyn will make and send you one of her recycled denim aprons with African textile accents. She'll also include a seasonal recipe to try out the first time you wear it.

Seasonal Organic Dinner for Two ($100) Jocelyn loves love and will make a seasonal 4 course meal for you and someone you hold dear to enjoy.  She'll also bring a brassicas bouquet, candle light, and a poem honoring our deep connection to the story of food and one another.Customized Cooking Class & Seasonal Organic Dinner for Two ($275) Jocelyn agrees with the saying, "Cooking with love provides food for the soul."  She looks forward to joining you at the hearth to bring the love letters between cooks she calls recipes to life.  You will get to select a technique and a world cuisine to focus on during the 2 hour class. She'll leave you to enjoy your 4 course dinner with a brassicas bouquet, candle light, and a poem honoring our deep connection to the story of food and one another.

Dinners are limited to Bay Area locals, but we can send you cookies and aprons anywhere! Deep deep gratitude to Jocelyn for all the sustenance she cooks up for communities near and far, and for her generosity to this campaign. Yum yum yum!









OFFER EXPIRED:

Courageous Creativity: The Work that Reconnects, Wildness, and Music as Medicine Workshop


Lydia Harutoonian M.A., Penny Livingston M.A., and members of the musical group Rising Appalachia, Leah Song and Chloe Smith will guide us through a deep experience on the land, exploring the connections between negotiating the realities of our time, music as medicine, and reconnecting to the wild. Joanna Macy Ph.D will offer a special teaching Wednesday morning.
Lydia will be our main guide in the Work that Reconnects, Penny will guide us in observing and listening with the land, Leah and Chloe will lead us in Global Sound Movement work as we engage in the profound teachings of the Work That Reconnects, and Joanna will offer us a teaching around empowerment, trust, and deep time. There will be a private concert on Tuesday night with Leah, Chloe and special guests that will be open to the local community. 
Support these amazing teachers and Eco Courageous Education Creations at the same time! Enrollment has filled up fast, but we have ONE SPOT WAITING for YOU if you grab this perk. Join us for these powerful two days ~ June 2nd and 3rd, 2015, at Commonweal Garden in Bolinas, California.
More details here!
SCOOP THIS UP TODAY! But also, if you don't get to scoop this one, don't worry! We've got plenty of perks to go around! Like...


                            
                                                                 PHOTO BOOKS
                                            4 different books! 4 different sizes!                                                                    Choose from:

Ecospiritual Selfies                                                                                                             MystiCali
   
Share the Sacred                                                                                                           and 12.21.12

   
with MORE BOOKS of photos and POETRY becoming available over the course of this campaign!



                   2015 or 2016 CALENDARS:  $222

                                                            Choose from:

Groves                                                     Friends that Food                   Fitting Into the Infinite



                                                        PHOTO PRINTS
                                   Choose from 12 Different Prints Here
                                                                                                  High Quality Digital Copy: $8
                                          Smaller High Quality Physical Print: $18
                                         Medium High Quality Physical Print:  $45
                              Large Poster Sized High Quality Physical Print: $165

ANY TIME NOW PEOPLE
~THE ALBUM~


                          
                    
                                                    ARRIVING LATER THIS YEAR!

ALBUM MP3 Download: $14 - Get the album first, as soon as it's ready.
CD: $20 - Buy the physical CD, like, for CD players.


VINYL: $88 - limited edition vinyl, you know who you are.


              OTHER SPECIAL PERKS: 

$110: Be in our music video! Home Howls will be filming in stunning locations around the bay where the ecology is transforming most rapidly. (If you're local) come play with us! If you're not local, there'll be opportunities for you to be in a video too! Coming soon!


                                    


$120 Haircut Josh will cut your hair. It's something Josh loves doing and is actually really skillful at. You can ask any of his previous haircuttees. The only bad haircut he ever gave was to his Brooklyn housemate who insisted Josh cut his hair by candlelight, listening to opera on full volume. Josh will make sure we have enough light to see what's hairpening.
                                           
$145: Consultations For individuals, partners, houses and communities - how are the changes around us affecting your life now and your expectations for life in the future? Josh will offer a 90 min conscious, compassionate holding of the hardest parts and reassuring support for transformational imagination and agency around these challenging questions.

                                          


$650: Design Your Own ECEC Workshop Josh will design an Eco Courageous workshop to meet your community's needs. That could mean so many things. Let's discuss!
More Perks Arriving Weekly...






ROOTS AND ORIGINS






The art and teachings carried inside this Eco Courageous basket, while gratefully held in supportive community, have so far remained solely the soul expression of 33 year old Joshua Halpern, MA,  in the direct lineage of Josh's neighbor and teacher Joanna Macy, who has stood for six decades as one of the greatest living guides for healing the woundings of our planet.




Josh has been sharing sacred earthly relationships through art for over two decades, with a special sensitivity to the relationships that accompany transforming home. Josh was born and raised at the confluence of the Matawan and Wopowog Rivers in Princeton NJ, the son of two professors committed to both the journeys of the soul and the achievement of justice on the planet. Josh grew up playing in his father's garden and in the woods by the river, loving writing, music, and photography from a young age. He received a BFA in Film/Television from NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts in 2004.


While in school, Josh’s father Manfred died, and Josh spent the next several years making art unfolding his family’s reactions to this loss. A few of these works can be found here. Having discovered a great deal about his roots, Josh turned his attention to stories outside of himself, launched outsidejosh.com, and went WWOOFing - traveling around the world for 9 months in 2007, lending a hand on organic farms in Hawaii, the Philippines, Thailand, and India. Josh’s film about this journey WWOOF ‘n Wander (53 mins) is streaming here in seven parts.

Upon returning to his home hemisphere, Josh worked for three years as the Organic Produce Coordinator for the best natural food store in New Jersey, the Whole Earth Center, deepening his connection with local food and food justice, and helping his mother vacate the house his family had called home for 50 years.






Working with his heart and hands, helping tend close relationships between people and soil, Josh began to recognize planetary forces interconnecting within the choices available to neighborhoods on the ground. He became moved to really study all the strands - what's unravelling and what's weaving together around us - and add more minds to his mix of understanding.
So in 2010 Josh moved to the Bay Area to pursue a masters degree at the California Institute of Integral Studies, studying with a community of deeply caring and conscious cross-pollinating scholars, healers and activists, receiving his MA in Integral Ecologies in 2013.

Integral Ecologists help communities and individuals regenerate mutually enhancing relationships with the Earth. This can cover a range of earthly scales - from building local systems to perpetuate what's precious to different communities - to attending to the needs of families whose homes can no longer hold them, falling into the already staggering numbers of climate-based refugees around the world. Josh doesn't have anywhere near all the answers, but in consultation work, teaching events, and creative placeplaying, he cultivates a steady ability to hold and share the questions, and integrates great diversities of perspective for deeply crucial choices, drawing from different directions depending on the details, including ~
         ~ ecopsychology~ expressive arts therapy           ~nature based healing modalities                     somatics ~                                                                                                                        ~ permaculture                                                                                                      ~ transition town initiatives                                                                                               growing food as medicine~                                                                                       ~regenerative design                                                                                 ~integrative health                up-to-date climate science ~     ~ planetary biologiescosmology ~       ~ quantum physics                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                deep ecology ~                                                                                                                                 ~ ecofeminism                                                                                                            environmental ethics ~                                                                                  ~ the spectrum of ecological humanities                  ~  indigenous wisdom traditions                                    ~ cross-cultural spiritual understandings                                                  ~ immanent place-based ceremonies                                              ~ the responsibilities of                                                      shared solidarities in the                                                       continuing struggles                                                           for peace and                                                             health and                                                              justice.
While not creating educational art, Josh juuuuuuust gets by selling local raw honey at farmers markets all over the Bay Area for Marshall's Honey Farm, and he loves this job - the opportunity to trade fresh food with neighbors, talk about how the bees are doing, track how the drought's affecting his farmer friends at the market. 


So far, Josh has continued to offer almost of all of the creative eco-educational art and teaching he's developed for free, as gifts to the communities he loves and is concerned for. Josh trusts this work has become the confluence of his life's rivers, and he sees helping folks deal with the changing planet as his life's work - far beyond this campaign and even beyond the places he currently wishes to hold as home. It would be helpful for this commitment to generate a livable income while the world changes and our work ramps up, but Josh will continue to show up as a bridge between generations, however strong the winds on the bridge may blow. Crowd-funding allows for the grounded and realizable steps to build this commitment to the levels where fruitful collaborations become inevitable.


 Josh is currently calling himself a Metamorphosis Ecologist (though you can call him whatever you want.) He feels this sounds poetic and honors the imaginal cells in the dying caterpillars that transform into butterflies. Most folks will not have met a Metamorphosis Ecologist before, or even want to. Josh messes up plans by truth telling. But he's learned to shake people up lovingly, and for some time he's been able to cultivate a life where community really supports and encourages new ways of relating. And there are generations of learning ahead of us. Healing relationships with the transforming earth is, as they say, a "growth industry".
Testimonials here







Challenges and Potentials
Indiegogo encourages us to be forthright with challenges our projects might face. There are personal and political challenges to the work Eco Courageous Education Creations have planned here.




Josh is deeply committed to providing avenues where silenced voices (the oppressed, the near extinct, the magical) can sing, places where each of our neighbors is welcomed in wholeness. He is driven to make a real difference in healing people's relationships with their home. So it doesn't always feel clear how dancing in disappearing marshes, or dressing up as future animals helps anyone directly. This is a very important question for each of us. What does help? Josh is really curious. Some aspects of our lives change too quickly, others agonizingly slow. No matter what we might do, it gets grim sometimes. There's truth in that hopelessness. But doom and gloom don't inspire, won't ignite anyone's passion or agency. We each know the ways we try to help or hold back the tide. But holding and sharing our shifting worlds also seems to require letting in increasing amounts of unbearable information and persisting with courage towards what seems impossible.





This reveals one of our main gifts of this moment - the challenge of embracing radical uncertainty. As Joanna Macy says, "If anyone tells you they know how it's going to turn out, don't believe them!" When facing the deepest unknowns we've collectively encountered, doesn't it help to feel held in the supportive arms of a rapidly expanding community of eco-activist souls rising in love and defense of the planet? We're moving through and beyond our individual separate stories, into strategies and solutions that include all of us. Supporting creativity and courage, mixing humor into our heartbreak, we learn to hold and share this sacred home together, and we imagine and commit to all the healing our particular place and position provides.


Thank you for doing everything you can today! Our brightest lights, currently throwing themselves into these climate questions, having reached the effectiveness limits of graphs and charts and lectures, all continue to call out for alternative educational models, and for radical art.








This is what Josh, through his body and soul, is able to offer today. You can help him continue bringing these offerings to the world. Josh releases expectations that Eco Courageous Education Creations will save civilization or rescue the functioning biosphere. But every chance he gets, Josh very much wants to support honesty, humor, healing, gratitude, generosity, inspiration, imagination, curiosity, and courage ~ as we unfurl our future together.

Or, as the poet Rainer Maria Rilke comes through Joanna Macy's translation, to "love the things as no one has thought to love them":


Dear darkening ground,you've endured so patiently the walls we've built,perhaps you'll give the cities one more hourand grant the churches and cloisters two.And those that labor—let their workgrip them another five hours, or seven,before you become forest again, and water, and widening wildernessin that hour of inconceivable terrorwhen you take back your namefrom all things.Just give me a little more time!I want to love the thingsas no one has thought to love them,until they're worthy of you and real.- Book of Hours, I 61







Other Ways You Can Help
Deep gratitude for sharing this moment together, and of course not everyone is able to help financially. If you'd like to collaborate with us, enliven the eco courageous community, come on down! Or we can come to you! Get in touch, joshua@ecocourageous.com, for any reason in the world. We'd love if you send us a testimonial or endorsement or blurb if you've been already moved by Josh's work. But really, everything you do that encourages courage in the face of climate change is absolutely welcome. Courage grows from our togetherness.
Eco Courageous Education Creations also has a patreon page (coming soon), as well as ecocourageous.com where you can read more details, and all shares, tweets, likes, and in person hugs are super beneficial and welcome as well.
Thanks,
Fruitful transformations!
Josh

story:
Solar Energy to Earthquake Affected Areas:

A group of responsible Individuals, who were also victim of the devastating earthquake experienced on Nepal at 25th April, highly expertise on different background on IT sector, Renewable Energy consisting of 4 members have initiated this project.
Due to earthquake the city historical monuments along with residential building have been ruined.Since kathmandu is capital city of Nepal, it is getting all the help it needs.
But here, we are focusing on those villages, Gorkha,Lamjung and Sindhupalchowk and many more upper villages which has been highly affected. People need electricity and as we all know, it will take many days to provide electricity to them.
So we came up with an idea to place renewable solar energy at those highly affected areas and help them in someway.Initially we will be providing with handy solar lights and torches.Since they dont have any options to get light in darkness from anywhere,this project could really help them have a bit of easiness in this darkest period of Nepal history.

What We Need & What You Get

We will be getting solar torch lights from Mukti Energy Limited,one of the renewable energy provider company in Nepal.They are providing it without any profit margin and with discount as well as a part of their CSR.

Once we reach adequate amount of torches and lights,those will be deployed to affected villages and remote areas providing at least 2 lights for each affected family.


The Impact

If we could bring this project and idea in action, the life of the people would get easier.

Light in darkness will provide them feeling of security .Moreover, since this is renewable energy, it wont take long time to put in practice like that of wired electricity.

No wires in surroundings, which will create a more safer environment and of course, it will long last due to which your help will help them even after many months in some way.

Risks & Challenges

The cost we need to acquire is less $20 approx per light. And the target is to supply these lights in 11 different highly devastated areas and villages which has been recorded till date.

We have all the manpower and transportation ready. We just need funding to initiate this project .

story:
On Wings of Waste is a pioneering flight from San Francisco to Alaska powered solely by a revolutionary recycled plastic fuel.

50 percent of the plastic we use is only used once before being thrown away. This is a massive problem because plastic can take hundreds of years to degrade. Which means that almost every piece of plastic ever made, still exists.

The world is currently being choked by end of life plastic that seemingly has no use, One Wings of Waste is a journey designed to change that perception. We believe that by putting a value on plastic rather than treating it in a disposable fashion, we can help rid our planet of this plastics plague. 

Plastic to oil technology is one these solutions. Rather than pilling plastic into landfill we can now turn it into a fuel, recycling the carbon and thereby reducing our reliance on fossil fuels. The fuel itself is more efficient and cleaner than other fuels and can reduce green house gas emissions by up to 70%. 

Sir David Attenborough has endorsed the flight saying, “It is a sign of hope in a very depressing world. At last a mechanism has been found by turning plastic waste into something that can be used and be valuable. The On Wings of Waste flight I hope will bring attention to the world to this great solution that is there waiting to be taken if only we can get the support of people to do so”.

Please join us on this groundbreaking journey that will change the way we use plastic and fuel forever. 

The Impact

This journey is designed to inspire humanity to realise it's capability to solve some of the planets most pressing issues.

 By flying a plane on a recycled plastic fuel for the first time, we hope to show people that we can make the switch to more sustainable and clean forms of consumption. On Wings of Waste will:

  • help solve the world's plastic problem
  • help solve climate change 
  • highlight the hard work that innovators are doing to make the world a better place 

What your funding supports!

- The plastic waste to fuel RV9 plane

- Crate / delivery / insurance and rebuild

- Design - body stocking of names on the plane

- The support plane and pilots

- Project management 

- Logistics 

- Security 

- Public relations

story:
Short Summary

We are a group of outdoor enthusiasts  in the four corners who are interested in dedicating and developing trails for recreation and public use in our backyards! 

What We Need & What You Get

The first annual Very Scary Time Trial will be held on Halloween, Sat. Oct. 31.  The course will be the complete 9-mile "Beatles Tour" at the new Geer Memorial trails. Racers will depart from the Geer Memorial lot on Rd. L at one minute intervals beginning at 10:00am.

The minimum sponsor pledge to participate is $30.  So, if you get three friends to pledge $10 each, you are in.  Or you could get one sponsor to just pledge $100...you get the idea. There will be a prize awarded to the rider who raises the most money. 

IF YOU ARE MAKING A DONATION TO SPONSOR ANOTHER ATHLETE, BE SURE TO   PUT THE NAME OF THAT RIDER IN THE COMMENT BOX ON THE CONTRIBUTION PAGE!

This event is being organized with volunteer efforts and ALL funds raised will go to the Montezuma Land Conservancy. Time bonuses will be given for amount of sponsor donations, pre-ride miles, and riding in costume.  Timing will be tracked using Strava.  If you don't currently have a free Strava account you can set one up by going to www.strava.com.  Once on Strava go to the Very Scary Time Trial club to register.   Follow us on FaceBook, Strava, or the MLC  web site below to learn about exciting prizes and additional details.  This is a fundraiser benefiting the Montezuma Land Conservancy.  The proceeds of which will be dedicated to developing easements on property with public access for trails and recreation.  Please visit the Land Conservancy website for more information on the awesome services that they provide for our community and the world at large: http://www.montezumaland.org/ 

The Impact

The Montezuma Land Conservancy is in the process of establishing an easement on 50 acres with five plus miles of trail adjoining the city's newly established Geer Memorial open space. This easement will ensure in perpetuity access for the public's use and enjoyment of the property. This will help set a precedent for area land owners to open their property for the development of trails and share open spaces, ensuring public access for future generations! 

Risks & Challenges

People value open spaces and access to the outdoors. If we don't act now to secure access to open space in our area, future generations will not be able to enjoy the quality of life which we all value in the outdoors. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Go to the Montezuma Land Conservancy website: http://www.montezumaland.org/ to learn more.

Also, check out the indiegogo share tools to help us make this fundraiser possible!

story:
My Story

Hi. I am James. I had a realization that as a species we are running out of time, and in order to reach our future, we need to make a global change on how we live.

We need to change the fate of our world by changing the way we grow and consume food. We need to have a plant-based diet and live a plant-based lifestyle. The plant-based diet is already working and proven by millions of people. And the number of Vegans around the world is growing everyday.

The way to accomplish this change is by creating a social media website called onebillionvegans.com, that brings together billions of Vegans as a community.

No longer will you spend hours sifting through profiles on social media websites, hoping to find a fellow Vegan who happens to live nearby, let alone shares your ambitions. With this Vegan social media website, you simply sign up, create your profile, and find likeminded people with every click.

We want all of us to be able to experience living a long and healthy plant-based life.

The Problem

We are growing enough food to feed 10 billion people, but instead, we choose to feed our crops and give over 50% of our fresh water to animals that we consume as our food.

In the last 50 years, we have destroyed more than half of our world’s trees. Trees are cut down at a rate of 40 football fields a minute just to give cows a place to graze!

The world is dying. Starvation is killing 14,000 people every day, almost 100,000 people die every week.

We really are out of time, and have to act now, so the world does not continue to starve, suffocate, and poison itself. It is time to heal, so we can reach the future, for ourselves and for our next generations.

What I Need & What You Get

Large-scale projects call for large-scale ambitions. We are looking to raise at least $1 million dollars. This is a massive undertaking that requires web development, web hosting, experts, programmers, marketing, and hiring other amazing staff members.

Your contribution of any amount will help us in the building of this Vegan social media website for a Plant-Based world.

What we all get is a healthier planet, healthier people, and more time on Earth for everyone.

You can make the difference!

story:
Help us fight deforestation in Sub-Saharan Africa!


Why did the hammock plant two trees? To solve the ROOT of the problem. See what we did there? ;)

In an effort to accomplish our mission of serving both our hammocking friends and the planet, Vitae Brands has chosen to focus on planting trees.  Doing so will not only help replenish our environment, but also ensure that you always have a great place to "hang out."  While we think planting one tree per hammock would definitely make a difference in the world, we would hate to leave you hanging with only one trunk...so we've decided to plant TWO TREES FOR EVERY HAMMOCK SOLD.  

  • Vitae Brands was founded to be a mechanism of positive change in the World.
  • We need your help launching our first product and planting our first round of trees!
  • Help us reach, or, even better SURPASS our initial goal of planting 500 trees! In partnership with Trees for the Future, for EVERY hammock sold we will fund the planting of two trees in Sub-Saharan Africa to help heal the wounds of deforestation. 

What's in it for you?

  • Regardless of the physical distance between you and the Rainforest, the well-being of our home relies on the integrity of our forests.  Therefore, by supporting our Two Trees Program, you are investing directly in your future.  
  • You will be one of the FIRST proud new owners of a Vitae Explore DuoSwing adventure hammock!  
  • Every time you use your hammock you will swing happily knowing there will always be two trees in the world to strap into!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need YOU to help us launch our new Vitae Explore DuoSwing adventure hammock!
  • Your hammock bundle will include a Vitae Explore DuoSwing adventure hammock, a set of color-coordinated Vitae Explore hammock hanging straps and carry sack.  Oh and make sure to grab some firewood and your beverage of choice, because with your hammock you will also receive a magnesium fire starter that doubles as a bottle opener. #hammockhappyhour
  • 250 Hammocks (with straps) = 500 trees; help us reach this goal and fight deforestation around the globe!  Together, we can generate positive change.
  • It's very important to us that we surpass our goal and create momentum; so to give you more incentive, if we surpass our goal of 250 hammocks we will DOUBLE our tree planting committment. Here's the math: 250 hammocks = 500 trees. 251 hammocks = 1,004 trees.

Lime/Charcoal DuoSwing Hammock Bundle


Blue/Red DuoSwing Hammock Bundle


Black/Red DuoSwing Hammock Bundle


Orange/Charcoal DuoSwing Hammock Bundle


Ultimate Hammock Bundle (4 Hammocks w/Straps Included)



The Impact

Have you ever read "The Lorax" by Dr. Suess?  Turns out he was quite the environmentalist and the story of deforestation is truer today than ever.  Deforestation is REAL. Here are a few facts:

  • By the year 2030, we might only have 10% of Rainforests left and it can all disappear in a hundred years.
  • Up to 28,000 species can go extinct in the next quarter century due to deforestation.
  • The top reasons for deforestation include agriculture, logging, and biofuels.
  • Check out more deforestation facts and statistics over at www.theworldcounts.com.

Here's how we will make a difference:

  • The net cooling effect of a young, healthy tree is equivalent to ten room-size air conditioners operating 20 hours a day. - U.S. Department of Agriculture
  • The planting of trees means improved water quality, resulting in less runoff and erosion. This allows more recharging of the ground water supply. Wooded areas help prevent the transport of sediment and chemicals into streams. - USDA Forest Service

  • One acre of forest absorbs six tons of carbon dioxide and puts out four tons of oxygen. This is enough to meet the annual needs of 18 people. -U.S. Department of Agriculture

Risks & Challenges

Vitae Brands is "brand-spankin' new," which means our greatest obstacle currently is spreading our mission.  We are up for the challenge.  In order to overcome this, we will continue working to create a community of individuals who share our vision of bringing positive change to the lives of others as well as our environment in the following ways:

  • Ensuring you are 100% satisfied with our products.
  • Giving you opportunities to engage in discussion regarding the past, present, and future of Vitae Brands.
  • Fostering relationships with other companies and organizations who share similar values and working with them to improve our products, customer satisfaction, and environmental efforts.

Other Ways You Can Help

So maybe buying a hammock isn't an option...yet, BUT, you LOVE where this company is headed.  Stop and take a second to bookmark vitaebrands.com...okay phew...now you won't forget us.  Keep in touch and spread our mission!  

  • Stay close by reading our blog where you will find updates on new products, our progress (both environmental and as a company), and ways to improve your well-being through pursuing and sharing your own adventures.  
  • Word of mouth will be CRUCIAL in reaching our goal of planting our first 500 trees and we are counting on you to help us get there.  Share our mission with others, especially those who enjoy exploring, traveling, relaxing and have an appreciation for our planet!   Share Vitae Brands with your friends on Facebook, Pinterest, and Instagram.


Go Find It.

VitaeBrands.com

Here's how we will make a difference:


The net cooling effect of a young, healthy tree is equivalent to ten room-size air conditioners operating 20 hours a day. - U.S. Department of Agriculture

The planting of trees means improved water quality, resulting in less runoff and erosion. This allows more recharging of the ground water supply. Wooded areas help prevent the transport of sediment and chemicals into streams. - USDA Forest Service
One acre of forest absorbs six tons of carbon dioxide and puts out four tons of oxygen. This is enough to meet the annual needs of 18 people. -U.S. Department of Agriculture



Risks & Challenges
Vitae Brands is "brand-spankin' new," which means our greatest obstacle currently is spreading our mission.  We are up for the challenge.  In order to overcome this, we will continue working to create a community of individuals who share our vision of bringing positive change to the lives of others as well as our environment in the following ways:

Ensuring you are 100% satisfied with our products.
Giving you opportunities to engage in discussion regarding the past, present, and future of Vitae Brands.
Fostering relationships with other companies and organizations who share similar values and working with them to improve our products, customer satisfaction, and environmental efforts.



Other Ways You Can Help
So maybe buying a hammock isn't an option...yet, BUT, you LOVE where this company is headed.  Stop and take a second to bookmark vitaebrands.com...okay phew...now you won't forget us.  Keep in touch and spread our mission!  

Stay close by reading our blog where you will find updates on new products, our progress (both environmental and as a company), and ways to improve your well-being through pursuing and sharing your own adventures.  
Word of mouth will be CRUCIAL in reaching our goal of planting our first 500 trees and we are counting on you to help us get there.  Share our mission with others, especially those who enjoy exploring, traveling, relaxing and have an appreciation for our planet!   Share Vitae Brands with your friends on Facebook, Pinterest, and Instagram.


Go Find It.

VitaeBrands.com

story:
Short Summary

In 2015, we successfully created a documentary entitled The Reality of Storm Chasing. However exceptional this was, our main goal & focus has always been reliable and accurate weather reports via social media. The only way we can do that is by being in the field during severe weather events such as supercell thunderstorms, tornadoes, blizzards, winter storms and other extreme weather events. In our quest to provide accurate weather reports to our followers and local weather offices, we would like to invest in professional weather instrumentation such as the ones below. I, Francis Lavigne-Theriault, travel over 50 000km in a given tornado "season" across North America, which usually is from April to August for the team. In doing so, I have seen my fair share of severe weather from close lightning strikes to large tornadoes. Currently living in the Canadian Prairies, I have chased supercell thunderstorms from Manitoba to the Mexico border and Ontario.

 


Why Are Weather Instruments So Important?

Weather instruments provide accurate depictions of a specific environment. Being members of www.spotternetwork.org, we provide ground truths to the public (you) as well as local weather offices. Weather instruments are the only way to provide accurate weather data such as wind speeds, dew points, temperature, wind direction, etc.

"Researchers are convinced that learning more about how tornadoes form may significantly improve tornado forecasts and warning times. They hope that in the future, storm forecasts will include details about a tornado’s strength and lifespan." -NOAA



Our Goal

Our goal with this project is for the public (you) and weather offices to have free access to our data. Our GPS location marker already displays our location in real time and now anyone would have access to environmental weather information at our location. This will increase informed decision making for local weather offices issuing watches & warnings as well as the public when accurate weather information is needed.


What We Need


I have been in contact with the R.M. Young company in Canada and they have advised me of specific equipment for the purpose of mobile weather reports.

  • Heavy Duty Wind Monitor: this records wind speeds up to 224mph. This is the recommended one for us due to the high wind factor when we are driving, which can damage the propeller. Comes with ceramic bearings, which increases service life.

Price tag: ~1260$ (CAD) + tax



  • Electronic Compass / Serial Interface: this corrects the heading of the vehicle while we are driving.


Price tag: ~500$ (CAD) + tax



  • Meteorological "Translator": this translates the data from the sensors in a "readable" format (i.e. wind speed = 25mph)

Price tag: ~2106$ + 294$ (mounting panel) CAD + tax

------------------------------

Sub-Total: ~4100$ (CAD) + taxes + shipping costs

Total: ~5000$ (CAD) or more


*Prices & equipment will fluctuate since I have to call R.M. Young so we can discuss the most appropriate equipment for our use.




The Impact


1) YOU: You will have access to our location & weather information in real time. The purpose is that if you want to know what is going on at our location, you will have accurate information. This, combined with our already informative videos/pictures being shared on social media will make a "complete" picture of what our immediate location looks like (i.e. video/pictures, weather data & GPS location).

2) Weather Offices: Weather offices will be able to have access to this important weather data in real time as well as our location on the spotter network. They already use our location description when we are calling in weather reports such as tornadoes, large hail, damaging winds, etc. Now, with this weather information added to the mix, they will have the extra information needed for more accurate watches & warnings to be issued for the public.

Accurate weather information about a specific location/environment -> more informed decision making -> more accurate weather watches/warnings -> increased confidence in weather predictions by public





Risks & Challenges


Inherent risks are the nature of the environment we put ourselves through to give reliable ground truth information so you don't have to. Challenges will be accurately relaying the weather information in poor internet connection areas. Currently, the main challenge is acquiring the equipment, which cost thousands and thousands of dollars, but I believe monetary challenges can be overcome together.

story:
Yes! … our planet is being destroyed, as you read this, forests all over the world are being cut down, 30% of the Amazon rain forest has been lost in the last 50 years.

Today  we can do something about it !!!

We are Diego, Miguel, Sandra, Javier, Rodrigo, Natalia, Angelica, Marcelo, etc.... and we want to save our planet, and we would like to invite YOU to save it too, one forest at a time.

We have the opportunity to buy 500 hectares of primary rain forest in West Ecuador and declare this as an ecological reserve. This valuable area is renowned as a biodiversity hot spot. 

So far we have raised $50,000 but we need your help in raising the rest. 

Just imagine... 2 cents will protect one square meter, 1 dollar can save 50 square meters of primary rain forest!

It is a great opportunity to make a difference and together we can do it! 

For your contribution you get the GPS coordinates of the area you are protecting and a printable certificate.

For contributions over 500 dollars, you can camp (leave no trace camping of course) on your protected area. 

The property will be bought and placed under a trust fund and the trustees will manage it through the prosses.

This is it ! Most of us want to save our planet, but we don't know where to start. Start here!

After all, this is the only planet we have....

Help us save it !
