En plus des récompenses précédentes, faites partie de l'expérience de l'écoconstruction de la maison Suyana, ici avec nous. Nous definierons ensemble la date et le temps que vous souhaitez partager avec nous sur ce projet. (en plus des récompenses précédentes)

500$ - Changez de vie!

Goutez à la vie dans l'éco-maison Suyana pendant 2 nuits, et confirmez qu'un changement réel est bien possible! Valable pour 2 personnes (en plus des récompenses précédentes)


English

EcoCasa Suyana

An ecological, economical, sustainable and social home

The idea

Building a green and sustainable home that is socially and economically viable and that can serve as a model to be replicated. The construction will follow defined criteria in order to achieve low energy consumption, improve the quality of life and reduce environmental impact.

The entire project process will be documented and information will be distributed on a wide scale with free and open content, which will facilitate the reproduction of this type of construction, subject to the specific conditions of each site.


About Us

We are a young couple who decided to change our life. We sold our few possessions in Buenos Aires and began a trip in Latin America (you can visit our blog www.tiemposdeagua.com). Just before leaving, we received the wonderful news that we would soon be joined by another companion on our trip. This did not stop our adventure, and instead gave it more meaning. After months of travel in Argentina, Chile and Bolivia, we have decided to move to the mountains of Cordoba for a few months until our daughter's birth. We want to enjoy the time and space we gave ourselves for this moment, while investing ourselves in a stimulating and useful project for the community. After evaluating everything we have experienced so far on our trip, we decided to give life to this new idea.


The source of the idea

Shortly after beginning our trip around Latin America, our conversations concerning problems in the places we were discovering became more frequent. This was partly because we were together day and night, and especially because we were very open and sensitive to everything happening around us.

In each place, we discovered problems that appeared to have an easy solution from our perspective as educated individuals with environmental awareness and purchasing power. Unfortunately, we have found that these solutions are not as obvious to the local population and are not implemented.

For example, we felt the strong solar radiation in the south of Argentina and Chile, and yet solar energy is not exploited: we didn't see any solar heaters.

We experienced the constant winds of Patagonia, and we saw small wind turbines in many houses, but they were all halted. When we asked the locals about the state of the wind turbines, their answer was: "They were installed about two years ago, but they don't work. It seems that we misused the batteries, but we actually don't really know how the system works. Now we are waiting for someone to come fix the unit because the system is locked and only an expert can access it."

We smelled the raw sewage running through the streets of some cities in the north of Argentina, and discovered it was directly discharged into a river without treatment. The same river was a water resource for irrigation and farming.

We saw outdoor dumps around villages in Bolivia, polluting the environment and water resources, and creating unsanitary areas.

All these small examples made us think and ask ourselves: "What can we do to change things? How can we improve the quality of life of communities in Latin America? How can we protect and benefit from the natural resources of our continent? How can we limit the impact on the environment?"

Gradually, our idea began to take shape, and when we moved to the mountains of Cordoba, knowing that we would not travel for a few months, we began to think about what we could do in the time leading up to the birth of our daughter. We also thought of our new responsibilities and about what kind of world we want for our daughter. We thought about the questions she might ask: "And what did you do to change things? Did you limit yourself to observing and criticizing?" We believe that we must act, and today we are lucky enough to have given ourselves the time to do so. It's time to act, let's begin right now!


What is the solution?

Our idea is to build a green, sustainable, affordable home, that can be a model for the construction of community housing. We realize that in order to improve the quality of life and reduce the impact on the environment, we need to bring together various sustainable technologies and practices into one place: in a house that can be visited and serve as an inspiration for better housing.

The whole process will be documented and all information will be shared online for free.

Now that we have the opportunity to implement this project – as we have time and physical space – we have decided to demonstrate that this sustainable development approach is viable. This project will serve as an educational base accessible to all in the long term.

We believe the success of our project will be the result of our commitment to:

- Expertise: We value knowledge gained both through formal training and life experience.

- Cultural awareness: We know the place and local culture, so our project will focus on creating local solutions that can be adapted to other specific locations with similar conditions.

- A response to real and tangible needs: Throughout our trip, we consulted with communities about their needs, and we will confirm the information collected during the first phase of research, which will be an essential part in our project.

- Innovation: We are curious and innovative, and we are confident that this project has a technological and economic potential.


What criteria will we take into account?

- An economical house. We want to build an affordable home to help with what we noticed are common issues: lack of housing and rapid population growth.

- Keeping it simple. This property will be tailored to the population that could live there, avoiding abrupt cultural changes. The technologies in place should be simple to use and suitable for the community to reach greater social acceptance.

- Minimum maintenance. To reduce the risk of failure, the house and the technologies applied must require minimum maintenance and avoid (at best) any need of specialist intervention.

- Energy efficiency. The goal is to build a low-energy house, to minimize the impact of the environment and to reduce maintenance costs (using for instance solar water heaters and orientation integrating bioclimatic concepts).

- Save and reuse water. With filtration systems, water saving devices (taps, integrated diffusers, dual-flush toilets ...), greywater treatment, and other appropriate reuse systems.

- Reduce and recycle waste. The house's impact on the environment will be limited if the amount of waste generated by the occupants is reduced, by providing on-site solutions such as compost bins. Inorganic and organic waste will be separated. The compost will be used in the organic vegetable garden, which will be integrated into the home in a practical and aesthetic way, and provide fresh vegetables to be consumed throughout the year.

- A sustainable house. The main idea is that the construction and green practices are sustainable over time and adapted to everyday life.

- A replicable model. Our objective is to make this project a model for the construction of new homes and sustainable neighbourhoods, which can be reproduced and adapted to different scales and in different locations. Each decision taken will be justified, depending on the climate, population and the materials available . This is essential to adapt the model to other locations.

We are not necessarily talking about very sophisticated and expensive technologies, but small design improvements and easy green practices to reduce consumption and environmental impact, and to improve the quality of life.


Where do we start?

This was one of our questions, as gathering and processing data in order to start the project is not simple. We began by researching the different energy saving methods in general, and their efficiency and environmental impact. We looked at water treatment and reuse systems. We inquired about the approximate time required to build a house in this area. In order to keep our feet on the ground and create a concrete project, we have also talked to our neighbours so that they can tell us about their biggest problems.

With all the information we collected, in addition to our own experiences, we decided to take the big step: providing a framework for our project and finding a way to finance this dream. If we’re seeking a solution that will be of service to the community, why not ask the community to help us reach our dream? This is how we arrived at the idea of Crowdfunding. This platform to raise funds for our project and spread the world is very close to our idea of community support. We hope to find partners with the same values and concerns, who share our vision and can help us to help.


What's the plan?

During the current first stage, we are focused on communicating about the project, fundraising, and our research.

This research, which began a while ago, starts by exploring the data on initial local conditions: type of land, local climate, natural resources, access to water and basic services.

Then it will be time to find the most suitable solutions in the light of these initial conditions, always keeping in mind the criteria listed above. This includes a thorough research of the applicable technologies, of the materials available in the region, and of the cost of those technologies, in order to ensure the project remains affordable.

Each stage will be documented. After a summary of the results and decision making, it will be time to take the next step: purchasing materials and starting the construction of the house.

Once the house is built, after testing and facing different problems that may arise, we will focus on the appropriate way of sharing all the information gathered in order to replicate this model elsewhere. This last step is perhaps the most important, because our ultimate goal is to demonstrate that the construction of an ecological, economical and sustainable home is possible, and we will share all the information gathered during the project online for free. Furthermore, we want this project to have an educational aspect and plan to give lectures about the project and its feasibility.


How can you contribute?

A donation through Crowdfunding is important, but contributions which are not economically measurable are also essential. Everyone can help with:

- Sending useful information on technologies applied elsewhere

- Sharing the project! Forward this on to your friends, family and co-workers

- A word of encouragement

- Come volunteer and work with us on the field

EcoCasa Suyana is an ambitious project that requires a lot of work, but we are confident that together we can bring it to life. Any contributions and ideas are welcome!


Why support us?

We are determined to realise this dream. Many times in our lives - especially recently - we have been called crazy for the projects we undertake. However, we’ve been getting positive results and we’ve started to gather support and encouragement for our efforts. We adapt and are flexible in the face of new opportunities, such as the one that life is giving to us today. Let's be realistic, demand the impossible!


10$ - Preparing the ground

Thank You! Your contribution is key to us: we will put your name in the final report, on our blog and on social networks.

30$ - Each brick counts

You are part of Suyana! Your name will be written in a brick. You will receive a picture with your brick so that you can have in it your own home.

80$ - Exclusive information

In addition to the previous awards, you will be the first to receive all the project information in PDF. The bioconstruction of an eco-house like Suyana will no longer have secrets to you!

120$ - Share our dream

Wear proudly our super motivating shirt "Let's be realistic, demand the impossible!". Get inspired and share your story with us. What is your dream?

300$ - Let's get to work

Be part of the experience of the bio-construction of the eco-house Suyana, here with us! We will define together the date and time you want to share with us on the project. (in addition to all the previous awards)

500$ - Change your life!

Enjoy the eco-life in Suyana house for 2 nights and confirm that a real change is possible! Valid for 2 persons (in addition to all the previous awards)
story_txt:
En FRANÇAIS c'est par ICI! 
For the ENGLISH version press HERE!


Objetivo

Construir una casa
sustentable, que sea social y económicamente viable en una realidad
concreta, que sirva de modelo para la construcción de viviendas sociales. La
construcción seguirá los objetivos de: ahorrar energía, mejorar la
calidad de vida, y disminuir el impacto ambiental. 

Todo el proceso del
proyecto será documentado para poder difundir de forma masiva la
información recaudada desde su comienzo hasta su finalización,
facilitando la reproducción de este tipo de vivienda, respetando las
condiciones precisas de cada lugar.


¿Quiénes Somos?
Somos una pareja joven que decidimos cambiar de vida. Vendimos lo poco que teníamos en Buenos Aires y comenzamos un viaje sin tiempo por América (pueden visitar nuestro blog en www.tiemposdeagua.com). Justo antes de partir tuvimos la grata sorpresa que dentro de poco se sumaría un integrante más a nuestro viaje. Esto no hizo que se detuviera nuestra aventura sino que le dio mayor sentido. Luego de varios meses de recorrido en Argentina, Chile y Bolivia, decidimos instalarnos unos meses esperando el nacimiento de nuestra hija en las Sierras de Córdoba. Queremos aprovechar de este espacio que nos dimos para realizar un proyecto útil para la comunidad y estimulante personalmente. Evaluando todo lo vivido hasta ahora en el viaje, más las propias experiencias que cada uno traía de nuestro pasado, decidimos darle vida a esta nueva idea.




¿Cómo
nace la idea?
Al poco tiempo de comenzar
nuestro viaje por America, las conversaciones acerca de las
problemáticas de cada lugar que descubríamos eran cada vez más
frecuentes. 
A cada paso encontrábamos
problemas socio-ambientales que parecían tener una solución fácil, pero
probablemente era una visión desde la perspectiva de personas con
una determinada educación, consciencia ecológica o bien de un
cierto poder adquisitivo. Notamos tristemente que esas soluciones no
se aplicaban y no eran tan obvias para el lugar o la población como
nos parecía. 

Por ejemplo, vivimos la
fuerte radiación solar que hay tanto en el Sur Argentino como en el
Chileno, y sin embargo la energía solar no es aprovechada, no vimos
casi calentadores solares. 

Sentimos los vientos
constantes y veloces de la Patagonia, y vimos varias pequeñas
turbinas eólicas en las casas, pero estaban todas frenadas por falta de mantenimiento y de información de las poblaciones sobre el funcionamiento de las mismas.
Sufrimos el olor
nauseabundo por las calles de algunos pueblos del norte argentino, y
nos enteramos de que eran aguas sucias que estaban siendo enviadas de
forma directa y sin tratamiento al río, el mismo que sirve para el
riego y el ganado. 

Vimos montañas de basura
alrededor de los pueblos en Bolivia, contaminando el ambiente y los
recursos hídricos y creando lugares insalubres. 



Todos estos pequeños
ejemplos nos hicieron preguntarnos: 


Cómo mejorar la calidad de vida de los latinoamericanos? 


Cómo aprovechar los recursos naturales de nuestro continente? 


Cómo
vivir en mejor armonía con nuestro entorno y limitar el impacto
ambiental?


De a poco la idea
comenzaba a gestarse, y al llegar a las sierras de Córdoba,
instalarnos y saber que por algunos meses ya no viajaríamos, nos
pusimos a pensar en lo que podíamos hacer hasta que nazca nuestra
hija. También reflexionamos sobre nuestra nueva responsabilidad, y a
qué mundo queríamos traer a nuestra hija. Pensamos en la pregunta
que nos podría hacer ella en algún momento: “ Y ustedes qué
hicieron por cambiar algo? Sólo observaron y criticaron?“ Creemos
que debemos actuar, y ahora tenemos la suerte de habernos dado el
tiempo para poder hacerlo. Así que qué mejor que empezar ahora
mismo!


¿Cuál es
la solución?
Nuestra idea es construir
una casa de bajo consumo energético y sustentable, que sirva de
modelo para la construcción de viviendas sociales. Nos dimos cuenta
de que, para mejorar la calidad de vida de las personas y disminuir
el impacto ambiental, tenemos que juntar las diferentes tecnologías
y practicas sustentables en un solo lugar, que se pueda visitar y que sirva de inspiración para mejores
viviendas en otros lugares. 

A corto plazo esta
vivienda mejora la calidad de vida de la gente, y disminuye el
impacto ambiental a futuro. Todo el proceso será documentado, desde
su comienzo hasta su finalización, y toda la información recaudada
será compartida de forma gratuita
y masiva con la elaboración de un informe final. 
Cuando se nos presentó la
oportunidad de hacerlo realmente – ya que disponemos de tiempo y
del terreno físico – decidimos crear este proyecto demostrando que
este enfoque de sostenibilidad es viable, y que servirá de base
educativa accesible a todos a largo plazo.




Creemos que nuestro
proyecto va a tener éxito porque:
- Valoramos el
conocimiento que obtuvimos tanto en nuestra educación y profesión
como en nuestra experiencia de vida.
- Conocemos el lugar y la
cultura local, por lo cual nuestro proyecto estará enfocado en
brindar soluciones locales que podrán ser adaptadas a otros lugares
específicos con condiciones similares.
- Estamos enfocados en
responder a necesidades reales, y no solo impresiones. A lo largo de
nuestro viaje consultamos a las comunidades sobre sus necesidades, y
confirmaremos la información recaudada con una primera fase de
investigación, parte esencial en nuestro proyecto. Las soluciones
brindadas estarán adaptadas a la población, para su mejor
aceptación.
- Somos curiosos e
innovadores, y estamos convencidos que este proyecto tiene un
potencial que puede ser valorizado tecnológicamente y
económicamente.


¿Qué
criterios tomamos para el proyecto?
- Una casa
económica. Necesitamos una casa que
sea lo más accesible económicamente, ya que vimos en muchos lugares
la falta de viviendas. 

- Una casa simple. Esta vivienda estará
adaptada a la población que la podría habitar, evitando cambios
culturales drásticos. Las tecnologías implantadas tienen que
mantenerse simples de uso y adaptadas a la comunidad, para que tenga
una mayor aceptación social.
- Poco
mantenimiento necesario. La vivienda y
sus tecnologías deben requerir el mínimo mantenimiento
especializado posible, en caso contrario existe el riesgo de que
dejen de funcionar pronto.
- Eficiencia
energética. El objetivo es reducir los
gastos energéticos para minimizar el impacto ambiental y disminuir
los costos de mantenimiento. (Ejemplo: Colectores solares,
orientación incorporando conceptos bioclimaticos)
- Racionalización
y reuso de agua. Con sistemas de
filtrado, mecanismos de ahorro de agua (grifería, difusores
incorporados, inodoros con doble descarga...), reutilización de aguas
grises, y otros sistemas de reuso apropiados. 

- Minimizar los
desechos. Logrando producir menos
desechos y reutilizar los mismos, reduciremos el impacto ambiental de
la vivienda. Los residuos serán separados entre inorgánicos y
orgánicos, reciclando estos últimos en composteras. El compost
obtenido será utilizado en la
huerta orgánica, que estará integrada a la casa de una manera
funcional, estética y proporcionará gran parte de los vegetales
frescos que se consumen durante todo el año. 

-
Sustentabilidad. La idea principal es
que la construccion y estas practicas sean durables en el tiempo, y
que se adapten a la poblacion como algo cotidiano.
- Un modelo
reproducible. Nuestra visión es que
este proyecto sirva como modelo para la construcción de nuevas
viviendas y barrios sustentables, que se pueda reproducir y adaptar a
diferentes escalas y en distintas localidades. La justificación de
cada decisión es clave para poder adaptar este modelo a otros
lugares, acorde con el clima, la población y los materiales
disponibles. 
No estamos hablando forzosamente de tecnologías muy
sofisticadas y costosas, sino pequeñas mejoras constructivas y
practicas fácilmente implementables para reducir consumo, impacto
ambiental, y mejorar significativamente calidad de vida.

¿Cómo
empezar?
Fue uno de los grandes
interrogantes, poder concentrar mucha información procesarla y
arrancar el proyecto no es nada sencillo. Comenzamos investigando de
forma general los diferentes métodos de ahorro de energía y de
producción de la misma de la forma más eficiente y menos
contaminante posible. Averiguamos sistemas de tratamiento y reuso de
aguas, y los tiempos aproximados necesarios para la construcción de
una vivienda en esta zona. Para quedarnos en un proyecto muy
concreto, decidimos igualmente preguntar a la comunidad local cuáles
eran sus mayores problemáticas. Definimos cuales eran los criterios claves que proporcionan un marco para el proyecto. 
Así con esta
información reunida, más nuestras propias experiencias decidimos
dar el siguiente paso y buscar la manera de financiar semejante
sueño. Si buscamos una solución que termine siendo un servicio a la
comunidad, que mejor que apelar a ella para lograrlo: ahí es cuando
nos dirigimos hacia el Crowfunding. Creemos que esta plataforma para
recaudar fondos y dar a conocer nuestro proyecto se acerca mucho a la
idea comunitaria que poseemos. Esperamos conseguir colaboradores con
los mismos valores y preocupaciones que nosotros, que compartan
nuestra visión y nos ayuden a ayudar. 




¿Cómo se
va a desarrollar el proyecto? 

En esta primer etapa
toda nuestra energía está enfocada en darle difusión,
conseguir los fondos, y paralelamente
seguir investigando. 

Esta investigación
que ya empezó hace un tiempo, reúne en un principio datos del tipo
de terreno que poseemos, el clima de la zona, los recursos naturales
disponibles, el acceso al agua y a los servicios básicos, en fin
todo el relevamiento de las condiciones
iniciales locales. 

Luego será la hora
de buscar la solución más adecuada
posible a estas condiciones, siempre basándonos en nuestros
criterios
antes mencionados. Esto incluye la investigación minuciosa de las
tecnologías aplicables, los materiales disponibles en la zona, el
pedido de presupuestos, entre otras.
Cada etapa del
proceso será documentada. Una vez que tengamos los resultados y las
decisiones tomadas,
será la etapa de la compra de los materiales para luego comenzar la
construcción
de la vivienda. 

Una vez terminada la
vivienda, ya habiendo sido probada y solucionado los diferentes
problemas que se podrían presentar, nos dedicaremos a la difusión
adecuada para reproducirla en otros lugares. Esta última etapa es
tal vez la más importante, ya que nuestro objetivo final es
demostrar que se puede construir una vivienda
económica, ecológica y sustentable, y
compartir la información.
Además, no sólo queremos dejar los datos para acceso libre, sino
realmente educar a las personas, dar charlas sobre el proyecto y
sobre la factibilidad de reproducirlo.

¿Cómo
colaborar?
Una gran ayuda es el
aporte económico por medio del Crowfunding, pero no menos importante
son esos aportes que no se pueden medir con dinero. Todos pueden
ayudarnos con:
- Enviarnos información de utilidad
acerca de tecnologías aplicadas en otros lugares
- La difusión del proyecto
- Una palabra o mail de aliento, una
crítica constructiva
- Sumarse como voluntario tanto para la
hora de la mano de obra como para la comunicación
En
fin, es un proyecto ambicioso y es mucho el trabajo, pero estamos
convencidos que juntos lo podemos lograr. Toda colaboración e ideas
son bienvenidas!



¿Por qué
apoyarnos?
Tenemos una gran
convicción y determinación para realizar este sueño. Muchas veces
en nuestra vida - y especialmente en este último tiempo - han
considerado que lo que emprendíamos era una locura, pero al ver los
buenos resultados nos han comenzado a apoyar. Sabemos adaptarnos a
las situaciones y somos flexibles ante una nueva oportunidad, como la
que nos presenta hoy la vida. Seamos
Realistas, Hagamos lo Imposible


Français



Projet
EcoCasa Suyana
 Maison
écologique, économique et durable
Objectif
Construire
une maison écologique, durable, qui soit socialement et
économiquement viable, qui serve de modèle pour la construction de
logements. La construction suivra les objectifs d'économie
d'énergie, d'amélioration de la qualité de vie et de réduction de
l'impact sur l'environnement. 

L'ensemble
du processus du projet sera documenté et l'information sera
massivement diffusée, ce qui facilitera la reproduction de ce type
de logement, en respectant les conditions spécifiques de chaque
site.



À
Propos De Nous
Nous
sommes un jeune couple qui a décidé de changer de vie. Nous avons
vendu le peu de choses que nous avions à Buenos Aires et commencé
un voyage sans limite de temps en Amérique latine (vous pouvez
visiter notre blog sur www.tiemposdeagua.com). Juste avant de partir,
nous avons eu l'agréable surprise que bientôt nous allions
accueillir un autre membre qui ferait partie du voyage. Cela n'a pas
empêché notre aventure, et au contraire lui a donné plus de sens.
Après plusieurs mois de voyage en Argentine, Chili et Bolivie, nous
avons décidé de nous installer quelques mois en attendant la
prochaine naissance de notre fille dans les montagnes de Córdoba.
Nous voulons profiter de cet espace que nous nous sommes accordés
pour réaliser un projet stimulant et utile à la communauté. Apres
l’évaluation de tout ce que nous avons vécu jusqu'à présent
lors de notre voyage, nous avons décidé de donner vie à cette
nouvelle idée.

Comment
est née l'idée?
Peu
de temps après le début de notre voyage, les conversations sur les
problèmes particuliers à chaque lieu que nous découvrions se
faisaient de plus en plus fréquentes. En partie parce que nous
étions ensemble jour et nuit, et parce que nous étions très ouverts
et sensibles à tout ce qui se passait autour de nous.
A
chaque endroit, nous avons trouvé des problèmes sociaux et environnementaux qui semblaient
avoir une solution facile, mais il s'agissait probablement d'une
vision du point de vue de personnes avec une certaine éducation, une
conscience écologique ou bien un certain pouvoir d'achat. Nous avons
malheureusement constaté que ces solutions ne sont pas appliquées
et ne sont pas aussi évidentes aux yeux des habitants. 

Par
exemple, nous avons vécu le fort ensoleillement dans le sud de
l’Argentine et du Chili, et pourtant l'énergie solaire n'est point
exploitée: nous n'avons pas vu de chauffe-eau solaires.
Nous
avons senti les vents constants de la Patagonie, et nous avons vu par
endroits l’installation de petites éoliennes dans les maisons,
mais elles étaint toutes à l’arrêt. Lorsque nous avons interrogé
les habitants sur l’état des éoliennes, leur réponse fut:
“Elles ont été installées il y a deux ans, mais elles ne
fonctionnent plus. Il parait que nous faisons mauvais usage des
batteries, mais on ne sait pas vraiment comment cela fonctionne.
Maintenant, nous attendons que quelqu'un vienne fixer l'installation
car le système est verrouillé et ne peut être touché que par un
expert ".
Nous
avons souffert des odeurs nauséabondes des rues de certaines villes
dans le nord de l'Argentine, et avons découvert qu'il s'agissait des
égouts qui étaient directement déversés sans traitement vers le
fleuve, qui était lui-même utilisé pour l'irrigation et l'élevage.
Nous
avons vu des décharges d'ordures en plein air autour des villages en
Bolivie, polluant l'environnement ainsi que les ressources hydriques,
et créant des lieux insalubres.
Tous
ces petits exemples nous ont fait réfléchir et nous demander : 


Comment améliorer la
qualité de vie des communautés en Amérique latine? 
Comment
profiter et protéger les ressources naturelles de notre continent? 

Comment limiter l'impact sur l'environnement?


Petit
à petit, l'idée a commencé à prendre forme, et lorsque nous nous
sommes installés dans les montagnes de Cordoba, sachant que nous
n'allions plus voyager pendant quelques mois, nous avons commencé à
réfléchir à ce que nous pourrions faire jusqu'à la naissance de
notre fille. Nous avons également songé à notre nouvelle
responsabilité, et quel monde nous voulions pour notre fille. Nous
avons pensé a la question qu'elle pourrait nous poser à un certain
moment: "Et vous, qu'avez-vous fait pour changer les choses?
Vous êtez-vous limité à observer et à critiquer?" Nous
croyons que nous devons agir, et aujourd’hui nous avons la chance
de nous avoir donné le temps de le faire. Il est temps d'agir,
commençons des maintenant!



Quelle
est la solution?
Notre
idée est de construire une maison à faible consommation
énergétique, durable, qui servira de modèle pour la construction
de logements sociaux. Nous avons réalisé que, afin d'améliorer la
qualité de vie et réduire l'impact environnemental, nous devons
rassembler les différentes technologies et pratiques durables en un
seul endroit: dans une maison qui serve de modèle, qui puisse être
visitée et qui soit une source d'inspiration pour de meilleurs
logements.
L'ensemble
du processus sera documenté, du début jusqu'à la fin, et toute
information recueillie sera partagée gratuitement.
Lorsque
l'occasion de réaliser ce projet nous est apparue concrètement –
étant donné que nous avons le temps et l'espace physique - nous
avons décidé de donner vie à notre idée afin de démontrer que
cette approche de développement durable est viable, et servira de
base éducative accessible à tous à long terme.
Nous
espérons que notre projet sera une réussite car il repose sur les
points suivants:
-
La valorisation de nos connaissances obtenues autant au cours de nos
études et expériences professionnelles que personnelles.
-
La connaissance du lieu et de la culture locale, de sorte que notre
projet se concentrera sur la création de solutions locales qui
peuvent être adaptées à d'autres endroits spécifiques ayant des
conditions similaires.
-
La réponse a des besoins réels et concrets. Tout au long de notre
voyage, nous avons consulté les communautés au sujet de leurs
besoins, et nous allons confirmer les informations recueillies avec
une première phase de recherche, partie essentielle dans notre
projet. Les solutions proposées seront adaptées à la population,
afin de garantir une meilleure acceptation de celles-ci.
-
Nous sommes curieux et innovateurs, et nous sommes convaincus que ce
projet a un potentiel technologique et économique.

Quels
sont les critères que nous allons prendre en compte?
-
Une maison économique. Nous voulons construire une maison abordable,
car nous avons remarqué que le manque de logements et la croissance
démographique accélérée est un problème courant.
- Une maison simple. Ce logement sera adapté à la population qui
pourrait y vivre, en évitant des changements culturels trop
brusques. Les technologies mises en place devraient être simples à
utiliser et adaptées à la communauté, afin d'avoir une plus grande
acceptation sociale.
-
Entretien minimum. Afin de limiter les risques de pannes, la maison
et les technologies employées doivent avoir un entretien minimum et
éviter au mieux tout besoin d'intervention de spécialistes.
-
Efficacité énergétique. L'objectif est de réduire les dépenses
énergétiques pour minimiser l'impact de l'environnement et de
réduire les coûts d'entretien. (Exemple: Chauffe-eau solaires,
Orientation intégrant des concepts bioclimatiques)
-
Rationalisation et réutilisation de l'eau. Avec les systèmes de
filtration, dispositifs d'économie d'eau (robinets, diffuseurs
intégrés, toilettes à double chasse ...), traitement des eaux
grises, et d'autres systèmes de réutilisation appropriées.
-
Réduire les déchets. L'impact environnemental du logement sera
moindre si la production de déchets est réduite et s'ils sont
recyclés. Les déchets seront séparés entre inorganiques et
organiques, et ces derniers seront recyclés pour la production de
compost. Le compost obtenu sera utilisé dans le potager organique,
qui sera intégré dans la maison d'une façon pratique et
esthétique, et fournira une grande partie des légumes frais
consommés pendant l'année.
-
Une maison durable. L'idée principale est que la construction et les
pratiques nommées soient durables dans le temps, et adaptables à la
vie quotidienne.
-
Un modèle reproductible. Notre but est que ce projet soit un modèle
pour la construction de nouvelles maisons et de quartiers durables,
qui puisse se reproduire et s'adapter à différentes échelles et à
divers endroits. La justification de chaque décision est essentielle
pour adapter ce modèle à d'autres lieux, selon le climat, la
population et les matériaux disponibles. Nous ne parlons pas
nécessairement de technologies très sophistiquées et coûteuses,
mais de petites améliorations de conception, et la mise en place
d'actions facilement réalisables pour réduire la consommation,
l'impact sur l'environnement, et améliorer la qualité de vie de
manière significative.









Par
où commencer?
Ce
fut une de nos questions, rassembler des donneés et les traiter afin
de pouvoir démarrer le projet n'est pas si simple. Nous avons
commencé par faire des recherches sur les différentes méthodes
d'économie d'énergie en général, et sa production de manière
efficace et non-polluante. Nous avons découvert des systèmes de
traitement et de réutilisation de l'eau. Nous nous sommes renseignés
sur les temps approximatifs requis pour la construire d'une maison
dans cette zone. Afin de garder les pieds sur terre et de créer un
projet concret, nous avons également décidé d'en parler à nos
voisins et nous renseigner sur leurs plus grands problèmes.
Ainsi,
avec toutes ces informations recueillies, ajoutées a nos propres
expériences, nous avons décidé de faire le grand pas: donner un
cadre à notre projet et trouver un moyen de financer un tel rêve.
Si nous cherchons une solution qui sera un service à la communauté,
comment ne pas y faire appel afin d'atteindre cet objectif? C'est
ainsi que nous nous sommes dirigés vers le Crowdfunding. Nous
croyons que cette plate-forme pour lever des fonds et faire connaître
notre projet est très proche de l'idée d'entraide communautaire que
nous tenons. Nous espérons trouver des partenaires avec les mêmes
valeurs et préoccupations que nous, qui partagent notre vision et
nous aident à aider. 




Quel
sera le déroulement du projet?
Au
cours de cette première étape, nous sommes concentrés sur la
diffusion du projet, la collecte de fonds, et la poursuite de nos
recherches.
Cette
recherche qui a déjà commencé il y a un certain temps, recueille
en un premier temps des données sur le type de terrain que nous
possédons, le climat local, les ressources naturelles, l'accès à
l'eau et aux services de base, afin d'étudier toutes les conditions
initiales locales.
Ensuite,
il sera temps de trouver la meilleure solution possible en tenant
compte de ces conditions, en gardant toujours comme repère les
critères nommés ci-dessus. Cela inclut une recherche approfondie
des technologies applicables, des matériaux disponibles dans la
région, ainsi que de la demande de devis, entre autres.
Chaque
étape du processus sera documentée. Suite a la synthèse des
résultats et la prise de décision, il sera temps de passer à
l'étape d'achat des matériaux et de commencer la construction de la
maison.
Une
fois la maison construite, après l’avoir testée et fait face aux
différents problèmes qui pourraient survenir, nous allons nous
concentrer sur la diffusion appropriée afin de reproduire ce modèle
ailleurs. Cette dernière étape est peut-être la plus importante,
car notre but ultime est de démontrer que la construction d'une
maison économique, écologique et durable est possible, et nous
allons partager toute l'information assemblée au cours du projet. De
plus, non seulement nous voulons laisser libre accès aux données,
mais réellement contribuer à l’éducation des populations, donner
des conférences sur le projet et sur sa faisabilité.

Comment
contribuer?
La
contribution économique à travers le Crowdfunding est importante,
mais toute aide non mesurable économiquement est tout aussi
essentielle. Chacun peut nous aider avec:
-
L'envoi d'information utile sur les technologies appliquées ailleurs
-
La diffusion du projet
-
Un mot d'encouragement, des critiques constructives
-
Du travail de bénévolat sur le terrain
Enfin,
il s'agit d'un projet ambitieux qui demande beaucoup de travail, mais
nous sommes convaincus qu'ensemble nous pouvons lui donner vie. Toute
contribution et idée sont les bienvenues!



Pourquoi
nous soutenir?
Nous
avons une grande conviction et détermination pour réaliser ce rêve.
Plusieurs fois dans nos vies - et surtout ces derniers temps – nous
avons été qualifiés de fous par les projets que nous
entreprenions. Mais en voyant les bons résultats obtenus, nous avons
commencé à être soutenus et encouragés dans nos démarches. Nous
savons nous adapter et sommes flexibles face à de nouvelles
opportunités, comme celle que la vie nous présente aujourd'hui.
Soyons réalistes, faisons l'impossible!


10$ - Préparation du terrain
Merci! Votre contribution est essentielle pour nous: votre nom sera dans le rapport final, sur notre blog et les réseaux sociaux.
30$ - Chaque brique compte
Vous faites partie de Suyana! Votre nom sera écrit sur une brique de la maison. Vous recevrez une photo avec votre brique pour que vous l'ayez dans votre propre maison.
80$ - information exclusive
En plus des récompenses précédentes, vous serez le premier à recevoir toutes les informations du projet au format PDF. L'écoconstruction d'une maison comme Suyana n'aura plus aucun secret pour vous!
120$ - Partagez notre rêve
Portez fièrement notre motivant t-shirt "Soyons réalistes, demandons l'impossible!". Soyez inspiré et partagez votre histoire avec nous. Quel est votre rêve?300$ - Mettez les mains à la pate!En plus des récompenses précédentes, faites partie de l'expérience de l'écoconstruction de la maison Suyana, ici avec nous. Nous definierons ensemble la date et le temps que vous souhaitez partager avec nous sur ce projet. (en plus des récompenses précédentes)
500$ - Changez de vie!
Goutez à la vie dans l'éco-maison Suyana pendant 2 nuits, et confirmez qu'un changement réel est bien possible! Valable pour 2 personnes (en plus des récompenses précédentes)


English


EcoCasa SuyanaAn ecological, economical, sustainable and social homeThe
idea
Building
a green and sustainable home that is socially and economically viable
and that can serve as a model to be replicated. The construction will
follow defined criteria in order to achieve low energy consumption,
improve the quality of life and reduce environmental impact.
The
entire project process will be documented and information will be
distributed on a wide scale with free and open content, which will
facilitate the reproduction of this type of construction, subject to
the specific conditions of each site. 

About
Us
We
are a young couple who decided to change our life. We sold our few
possessions in Buenos Aires and began a trip in Latin America (you
can visit our blog www.tiemposdeagua.com). Just before leaving, we
received the wonderful news that we would soon be joined by another
companion on our trip. This did not stop our adventure, and instead
gave it more meaning. After months of travel in Argentina, Chile and
Bolivia, we have decided to move to the mountains of Cordoba for a
few months until our daughter's birth. We want to enjoy the time and
space we gave ourselves for this moment, while investing ourselves in
a stimulating and useful project for the community. After evaluating
everything we have experienced so far on our trip, we decided to give
life to this new idea. 


The
source of the idea

Shortly
after beginning our trip around Latin America, our conversations
concerning problems in the places we were discovering became more
frequent. This was partly because we were together day and night, and especially
because we were very open and sensitive to everything happening
around us.  

In
each place, we discovered problems that appeared to have an easy
solution from our perspective as educated individuals with
environmental awareness and purchasing power. Unfortunately, we have
found that these solutions are not as obvious to the local population
and are not implemented. 

For
example, we felt the strong solar radiation in the south of Argentina
and Chile, and yet solar energy is not exploited: we didn't see any
solar heaters.
We
experienced the constant winds of Patagonia, and we saw small wind
turbines in many houses, but they were all halted. When we asked the
locals about the state of the wind turbines, their answer was: "They
were installed about two years ago, but they don't work. It seems
that we misused the batteries, but we actually don't really know how
the system works. Now we are waiting for someone to come fix the unit
because the system is locked and only an expert can access it."
We
smelled the raw sewage running through the streets of some cities in
the north of Argentina, and discovered it was directly discharged
into a river without treatment. The same river was a water resource
for irrigation and farming.
We
saw outdoor dumps around villages in Bolivia, polluting the
environment and water resources, and creating unsanitary areas.
All
these small examples  made us think and ask ourselves: "What can
we do to change things? How can we improve the quality of life of
communities in Latin America? How can we protect and benefit from the
natural resources of our continent? How can we limit the impact on
the environment?"
Gradually,
our idea began to take shape, and when we moved to the mountains of
Cordoba, knowing that we would not travel for a few months, we began
to think about what we could do in the time leading up to the birth
of our daughter. We also thought of our new responsibilities and
about what kind of world we want for our daughter. We thought about
the questions she might ask: "And what did you do to change
things? Did you limit yourself to observing and criticizing?" We
believe that we must act, and today we are lucky enough to have given
ourselves the time to do so. It's time to act, let's begin right now!

What
is the solution?
Our
idea is to build a green, sustainable, affordable home,  that can be
a model for the construction of community housing. We realize that in
order to improve the quality of life and reduce the impact on the
environment, we need to bring together various sustainable
technologies and practices into one place: in a house that can be
visited and serve as an inspiration for better housing.
The
whole process will be documented and all information will be shared
online for free.
Now
that we have the opportunity to implement this project – as we have
time and physical space – we have decided to demonstrate that this
sustainable development approach is viable. This project will serve
as an educational base accessible to all in the long term.
We
believe the success of our project will be the result of our
commitment to:
-
Expertise:
We value knowledge gained both through formal training and life
experience.
- Cultural
awareness: We
know the
place and local culture, so our project will focus on creating local
solutions that can be adapted to other specific locations with
similar conditions.
-
A response to real and tangible needs: Throughout
our trip, we consulted with communities about their needs, and we
will confirm the information collected during the first phase of
research, which will be an essential part in our project.
-
Innovation:
We are curious and innovative, and we are confident that this project
has a technological and economic potential.

What
criteria will we take into account?
-
An economical house. We
want to build an affordable home to help with what we noticed are
common issues: lack of housing and rapid population growth.
-
Keeping it simple.
This property will be tailored to the population that could live
there, avoiding abrupt cultural changes. The technologies in place
should be simple to use and suitable for the community to reach
greater social acceptance. 

-
Minimum maintenance. To
reduce the risk of failure, the house and the technologies applied
must require minimum maintenance and avoid (at best) any need of
specialist intervention.
-
Energy efficiency. The
goal is to build a low-energy house, to minimize the impact of the
environment and to reduce maintenance costs (using for instance solar
water heaters and orientation integrating bioclimatic concepts).
-
Save and reuse water.
With filtration systems, water saving devices (taps, integrated
diffusers, dual-flush toilets ...), greywater treatment, and other
appropriate reuse systems.
-
Reduce and recycle waste.
The house's impact on the environment will be limited if the amount
of waste generated by the occupants is reduced, by providing on-site
solutions such as compost bins. Inorganic and organic waste will be
separated. The compost will be used in the organic vegetable garden,
which will be integrated into the home in a practical and aesthetic
way, and provide fresh vegetables to be consumed throughout the year.
-
A sustainable house.
The main idea is that the construction and green practices are
sustainable over time and adapted to everyday life.
-
A replicable model.
Our objective is to make this project a model for the construction of
new homes and sustainable neighbourhoods, which can be reproduced and
adapted to different scales and in different locations. Each decision
taken will be justified, depending on the climate, population and the
materials available . This is essential to adapt the model to other
locations.
We
are not necessarily talking about very sophisticated and expensive
technologies, but small design improvements and easy green practices
to reduce consumption and environmental impact, and to improve the
quality of life.
Where
do we start?
This
was one of our questions, as gathering and processing data in order
to start the project is not simple. We began by researching the
different energy saving methods in general, and their efficiency and
environmental impact. We looked at water treatment and reuse systems.
We inquired about the approximate time required to build a house in
this area. In order to keep our feet on the ground and create a
concrete project, we have also talked to our neighbours so that they
can tell us about their biggest problems.
With
all the information we collected, in addition to our own experiences,
we decided to take the big step: providing a framework for our
project and finding a way to finance this dream. If we’re seeking a
solution that will be of service to the community, why not ask the
community to help us reach our dream? This is how we arrived at the
idea of Crowdfunding. This platform to raise funds for our project
and spread the world is very close to our idea of community support.
We hope to find partners with the same values and concerns, who share
our vision and can help us to help. 

What's
the plan?
During
the current first
stage,
we are focused on communicating
about the project, fundraising,
and our research.
This
research, which began a while ago, starts by exploring the data on
initial
local conditions:
type of land, local climate, natural resources, access to water and
basic services.
Then
it will be time to find the most
suitable solutions
in the light of these initial conditions, always keeping in mind the
criteria
listed above. This includes a thorough research of the applicable
technologies, of the materials available in the region, and of the
cost of those technologies, in order to ensure the project remains
affordable.  

Each
stage will be documented.
After a summary of the results and decision making, it will be time
to take the next step: purchasing materials and starting the
construction of the house.
Once
the house is built, after testing and facing different problems that
may arise, we will focus on the appropriate way of sharing all the
information gathered in order to replicate
this model elsewhere.
This last step is perhaps the most important, because our ultimate
goal is to demonstrate
that the construction of an ecological, economical and sustainable
home is possible,
and we will share all the information gathered during the project
online
for free.
Furthermore, we want this project to have an educational aspect and
plan to give lectures about the project and its feasibility.

How
can you contribute?
A
donation through Crowdfunding is important, but contributions which
are not economically measurable are also essential. Everyone can help
with:
-
Sending useful information on technologies applied elsewhere
-
Sharing the project! Forward this on to your friends, family and
co-workers
-
A word of encouragement
-
Come volunteer and work with us on the field
EcoCasa
Suyana is an ambitious project that requires a lot of work, but we
are confident that together we can bring it to life. Any
contributions and ideas are welcome!

Why
support us?
We
are determined to realise this dream. Many times in our lives -
especially recently - we have been called crazy for the projects we
undertake. However, we’ve been getting positive results and we’ve
started to gather support and encouragement for our efforts. We adapt
and are flexible in the face of new opportunities, such as the one
that life is giving to us today. Let's
be realistic, demand the impossible!

10$ - Preparing
the ground
Thank
You! Your contribution is key to us: we will put your name in the
final report, on our blog and on social networks.30$ - Each
brick counts
You
are part of Suyana! Your name will be written in a brick. You
will receive a picture with your brick so that you can have in it
your own home.80$ - Exclusive
information
In
addition to the previous awards, you will be the first to receive all
the project information in PDF. The bioconstruction of an eco-house
like Suyana will no longer have secrets to you!

120$ - Share
our dream
Wear
proudly our super motivating shirt "Let's be realistic, demand the impossible!".
Get inspired and share your story with us. What is your dream?300$ - Let's
get to work
Be part of the experience of the
bio-construction of the eco-house Suyana, here with us! We will define together the
date and time you want to share with us on the project. (in addition to all the previous awards)500$ - Change
your life!
Enjoy the eco-life in Suyana house for
2 nights and confirm that a real change is possible! Valid for 2
persons (in addition to all the previous awards)

story:
The Plan

Imagine waking up on crisp morning, going for walk through 2400 acres of virgin bush land, full of birds and wildflowers, collecting bush food from a native food forest, taking a dip in a natural pond, ducking over to a workshop on earth building then planting a tree, all the while the Stirling Ranges fill the background. 

The Borden Nature Park Conservation project allows you, your family and friends to stay, enjoy and be directly involved with the care and management of part of one of the world's top 35 biodiversity hotspots.


Your Perks and our Goal

Our aim is to conserve and to rehabilitate 3000 acres of land in the South of Western Australia, to enrich the bush ecosystem with native pollinators and to build a sustainable living education centre, open to the public, where you can learn all about permaculture, earth building, cooking, rekii, pottery, woodworking, painting, yoga, crafting musical instruments and much more.
We will integrate sustainable, low impact accommodation facilities, in the form of a nature park, were you can stay up to twenty eight days and enjoy the beautiful landscape of the highest mountain range in WA. The nature park will be decked out with solar lighting, composting toilets and a common building with kitchen and laundry facilities. It's effectively a caravan park but without the bitumen roads, lawn and Mr Whippy :)

Community Roots Inc. needs to raise $150,000 to finalise the purchase of this land. So far, fifteen of us have put in $200,000 of our own savings . The full cost of the project is around $350,000 including setup & maintenace, tax, transfer and legal costs.

For your donation you will get some pretty sweet rewards. The greatest reward is that you are directly contributing to the conservation and protection of a precious piece of remnant bushland, containing species of flora and fauna found no where else on the planet. Secondly you can get one or all of the rewards below.

  • Five year associate membership to Community Roots Inc.+

  • (Up to 20) Native Tree with your name on it (not literally of course)- this tree will be planted on your behalf on the property. You will be able to find your tree on a map that will be displayed at the camp site on the property. So when you come to visit you can water and care for your very own tree.++
  • Up to five vouchers for a Nights Camping (Night Camping Voucher) on the land. You can use these in conjunction with your other free camping perks or you can give them to your friends.+++

  • Camping one weekend a month. You can camp at the property one weekend (it can be a long weekend :) every month.+++

  • Camping every weekend. Every single weekend you can come and stay in the beauty and get involved.+++

  • Camping for 1 week every month. You and your family can come and stay for a whole week every month.+++

  • Camp for 28 days...Three times a year - Three times a year you can come and stay for 28 days. So if you'd like to hang around for while, this is for you.+++
  • Insect Hotel - To really help pollination on the land you can sponsor an insect hotel. We will place this on the land on your behalf. These little hotels will create hot spots of insect activity on the land. We will put your name and its location on a map that will be displayed at the camp site.

                                   

  •  Cobb Bench Workshop - Get stuck in straight away. Come and learn how to build your very own beautiful cobb bench. I'm sure you've seen one of these beauties. This will be held in Fremantle on the 24th of October 2015...and will come with lunch.

                          

     

Every donation comes with a five year associate membership to the Community Roots association, so you really are a part of this project. This membership  will, among other things, get you free camping when you volunteer to be a part of our conservation projects on the land, a discounted rate on camping, early notification of workshops and events that we are running  and a reserved seat at workshops and events.++++

About Us

We are  Community Roots Inc. , a multicultural, not-for-profit association. We aim, through our work, to conserve the natural environment and to demonstrate low impact living. We want to teach and to learn how to live productively and non-destructively in the natural environment. Taking the best that modern science and methodology has and leaving out all the wasteful and toxic parts. We want to thrive in a community of individuals who makes progress each day with the use of collective knowledge and care for its neighbours. 

We believe in "Thinking of a better way and making it possible"


The Impact of Your Contribution 

The core reason for all of this is to conserve 3000 acres of precious remnant vegitation. This is not some kind wishful thinking, we are ready to go and have partnered with all the right people, so we know the results will be great.

Firstly, we are are joining a conservation project called Gondwana Link.


Gondwana Link aims to achieve reconnected, healthy and resilient country across South-Western Australia. It builds on many decades of conservation work. There is a goal to join 1000km of bushland. 900km has been achieved so far and we will be another 5km. Every bit helps.

Gondwana Link has three basic aims

  • restoring ecological connectivity across South-Western Australia, from the dry woodlands of the interior, to the tall wet forests of the far South-West corner;

  • protecting and restoring biodiverse bushland on an unprecedented scale; and

  • building a living link that reaches Eastward across the continent.

These aims are achieved by connecting national parks, reserves and private land reserves through a coordinated effort to create wildlife corridors with specific, highly researched and well executed strategies to protect and restore native plant and animal species. Please go and look at their website as they have so much more detailed information about the project.

http://www.gondwanalink.org/

We will also be partnering with Bush Heritage Australia to help us with landscape/biodiversity survey's to plan our revegitation and wildlife protection strategies, as well as funding for revegitation projects. Bush Heritage (with Greening Australia) is a major land owner between the Fitzgerald National Park and the Stirling Ranges National Park, so they've done a lot of conservation work in the area and know how to get things done.

http://www.bushheritage.org.au/

We are also joining forces with Nowanup. Nowanup is a Noongar focused conservation group run by local Noongar people located about 30km from the property. They run educational sessions with local schools and community groups, youth crisis intervention, Noongar Mens Business and Noongar Womens Business. First of all, they are going to do a culture survey for us to locate any significant sites. They might be artifacts, campsites, sacred sites and graves. We feel this is most important to do before we start any restoration on the site, so we know what the real history of this place is and to pay the proper respect to those people who walked this land before us. Nowanup has also offered to include us in their Landscape Songlines project. This is telling the stories of the land, both the dreaming and the modern story through physically planting songlines on the landscape. The idea is to generate a significantly sized piece of art that tells the story of the area that is visible from space. This is a project that has been started on the Nowanup property and we are honored that we can join in the telling of the story.

http://www.nowanup.com/

Like these organisations, we plan in the future to expand our work to more pieces of ecologically valuable land and to help others with this important work.


Risks & Challenges

The project will require a lot of hands on work and some of the construction and facilities will need shire approval. So there is a chance that we will not have everything ready for you to use right away. We would really appreciate your understanding if we are behind schedule.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to contribute non-finanically or if you wish to contribute at a higher level then what is indicated above please contact us at info@communityroots.org.au

Long term we would be looking to expand the boundaries of the property as well as acquiring more land with the same intention. So if you have any suggestion of locations or some suitable land please contact us.

We have lots of other ideas and discussions happening on our Facebook page, jump on and get project updates and contribute some of your ideas.

https://www.facebook.com/groups/858072064275484/


Map

+ 5 year membership start 1st January 2016 and expires 31st December 2020, after which time you will need to pay a yearly membership fee. This membership fee will be set yearly by the Community Roots Inc committee. Membership to Community Root Inc. is entirely optional, we are not going to force you to take the membership.

++ If your tree  unfortunately dies we reserve the right to not replant. There's a number of reasons a tree won't take and we will try our best to make it grow so tall but sadly we can't just keep putting in a new tree, it is part of life. We will begin planting trees January 2016, but we will not be planting every tree at the same time so it may a while before your tree is planted and listed.'

+++"Night Camping Voucher" will be avaible to be used from 1st January 2016 (Unless otherwise indicated, or delayed) for a maximum of 3 nights in any 3 month period. All  Other camping rewards are valid for 5 years from the day of the opening of the "Borden Nature Park" (Unless otherwise indicated). "Camping for 1 week every month" means seven consecutive days a month. "Camp for 28 days...Three times a year" means 28 consecutive days 3 times in one calendar year (minimum 28 days between stays).Camp sites are limited in number. We reserve the right to close the nature park from time to time so you are required to book ahead for all camping. Checkout time is 10:00am everyday. Camp sites can have no more then six persons staying overnight. 28 consecutive days is the maximum length of stay.

++++ Free camping will be subject to availablity and is for 2 persons or Family (parent/s and children) per camp site, limited stay lengths apply. Discount rate on camping will be set yearly by Community Roots Inc. and is subject to change without warning. A seat will be reserved for you for one week from the date of early notification. You are only reserved a seat for workshops and events that are run by Community Roots Inc.  , events that are not hosted by us will not be included in this offer.

story:
Short Summary

Green Initiative Zambia (http://greenzambia.org/) is a legally registered non profit organization has been in existence for 4 years with a mandate in protecting the environment through three strong pillars of hands on education, providing alternative livelihoods away from destructive one and policy engagements with government at all levels

The "printing of 160 Enviro Education Education Manual" is a campaign you must support because we want to move way from using international education materials which are not too helpful, We have developed the LOCALIZED manual which only needs printing and distribution in schools. These are schools that are in peri urban and rural parts of our catchment area that don't have much support from government. The beneficiaries to this project are 82 schools with atleast 50 students at each school as members of the environmental and wildlife clubs

Your contribution to help us print 160 copies will assist our teachers in schools who are matrons and patrons, have themed lessons but deal with local environmental problems in a more practical but comprehensively.

What We Need & What You Get

We are requesting you to support the printing of 160 copies of Environmental and Wildlife Education Manual that's will benefit 82 schools each school with a total of 50 students at each school as members of the Environmental Clubs. The cost for  printing one Environmental and Wildlife Manual is $40 making it $6,486 for 160 copies of which each school shall receive 2 copies.

By supporting this campaign, you get yourself recognized and appreciated by individual schools through ball pen written letters by kids from the clubs. You shall also get some drawings from their lessons derived from the manual and groups pictures of matrons and kids holding the Environmental and Wildlife Education Manual sent to you.
If we wont reach our goal, the money which shall be raised shall go into printing a few copies the money will afford.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

This project is very important to our community and beneficiaries because of high levels of negligence in protection of Natural Resources as a result of lack of education. This had made people abuse the consumption of Natural Resources making some species depleting, hence contributing to Climate Change.

By helping us print these materials, you shall locally help empower the students who are future generations get required hands on lessons, thereby securing bright future of conservation efforts of Natural Resources.

This will in turn assist our country Zambia successfully reach the Millennium Development Goal number 7 (MDG#7) of Environmental Sustainability.

Over the years i have ran successful project at Green Initiative Zambia that has won us public support. Among the projects is the Tree Planting project that made us win the Energy Globe Award, check the link please http://www.energyglobe.info/awards/national/awdid/62199/#.VYck3lLLphk

We need your support and be part of making this world a better place.

Risks & Challenges

With the experience is similar and much more great project in Zambia as my home country, we are placed at a better position to overcome some of challenges that may present themselves. We have one of our stuff member who has experience in some digital design. This will help us judge quality on the Environmental and Wildlife Education Manual from the printer meaning we shall make sure we have value for the money.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please you can also help by sharing this important project amongst your contacts. Thank you very much in advance
story_txt:
Short Summary Green Initiative Zambia (http://greenzambia.org/) is a legally registered non profit organization has been in existence for 4 years with a mandate in protecting the environment through three strong pillars of hands on education, providing alternative livelihoods away from destructive one and policy engagements with government at all levels
The "printing of 160 Enviro Education Education Manual" is a campaign you must support because we want to move way from using international education materials which are not too helpful, We have developed the LOCALIZED manual which only needs printing and distribution in schools. These are schools that are in peri urban and rural parts of our catchment area that don't have much support from government. The beneficiaries to this project are 82 schools with atleast 50 students at each school as members of the environmental and wildlife clubs
Your contribution to help us print 160 copies will assist our teachers in schools who are matrons and patrons, have themed lessons but deal with local environmental problems in a more practical but comprehensively.   What We Need & What You Get We are requesting you to support the printing of 160 copies of Environmental and Wildlife Education Manual that's will benefit 82 schools each school with a total of 50 students at each school as members of the Environmental Clubs. The cost for  printing one Environmental and Wildlife Manual is $40 making it $6,486 for 160 copies of which each school shall receive 2 copies. By supporting this campaign, you get yourself recognized and appreciated by individual schools through ball pen written letters by kids from the clubs. You shall also get some drawings from their lessons derived from the manual and groups pictures of matrons and kids holding the Environmental and Wildlife Education Manual sent to you.If we wont reach our goal, the money which shall be raised shall go into printing a few copies the money will afford.    The Impact Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:
This project is very important to our community and beneficiaries because of high levels of negligence in protection of Natural Resources as a result of lack of education. This had made people abuse the consumption of Natural Resources making some species depleting, hence contributing to Climate Change.
By helping us print these materials, you shall locally help empower the students who are future generations get required hands on lessons, thereby securing bright future of conservation efforts of Natural Resources.
This will in turn assist our country Zambia successfully reach the Millennium Development Goal number 7 (MDG#7) of Environmental Sustainability.
Over the years i have ran successful project at Green Initiative Zambia that has won us public support. Among the projects is the Tree Planting project that made us win the Energy Globe Award, check the link please http://www.energyglobe.info/awards/national/awdid/62199/#.VYck3lLLphk
We need your support and be part of making this world a better place.
  Risks & Challenges With the experience is similar and much more great project in Zambia as my home country, we are placed at a better position to overcome some of challenges that may present themselves. We have one of our stuff member who has experience in some digital design. This will help us judge quality on the Environmental and Wildlife Education Manual from the printer meaning we shall make sure we have value for the money.   Other Ways You Can Help Please you can also help by sharing this important project amongst your contacts. Thank you very much in advance

story:
Please join us on Thursday August 20th, from 6PM-12, at Dreamland (387 Franklin St. Buffalo, NY) for our 1st "Save Virachey National Park" Buffalo fundraiser. Live music will be provided by Folkfaces, RadaRada and DJ Crespo. We will also have a charity auction and 50-50 drawing.

If you cannot attend, please donate! No contribution is too small!

All funds raised from this campaign will go towards the wildlife camera-trapping program currently underway in the Park. We are a conservation group that specializes in going into underprioritised protected areas (PAs) and doing wildlife surveys that local governments and NGOs cannot or will not do. Our mission is to prove that these "paper parks" (national parks, wildlife sanctuaries, or other PAs that exist on paper but in reality get little or no real protection in the form of ranger patrols or government support) are worth being treated as "real" parks with adequate protection because of the wildlife they still shelter. We have already proven that Cambodia's Virachey National Park is still home to a plethora of wildlife (see our latest Featured video on Mongabay here), and in the Phnom Penh Post. You can also have a look at the project we did in Thailand here.

Our Virachey project is ongoing, but we are in need of funds to pay for ranger patrols, especially in the Vietnam border area where poachers, miners, and loggers cross over illegally into Cambodia to plunder the park. We also need funding to pay the VNP ranger's daily supply allowance (DSA) when they check on our camera traps, and of course there are expenses for new memory cards, lithium batteries, and silica desiccants to keep the cameras dry.  Our work as was recently cited in an excellent article on dholes in The Guardian.


Venue info-

https://www.facebook.com/dreamlandarts.buffalo

http://www.buffalonews.com/columns/colin-dabkowski/dreamland-taps-into-buffalos-creative-underground-20150208


Band info-

https://www.facebook.com/folkfaces

https://www.facebook.com/Radaradamusic?fref=ts
