story:
The Better World Market     

About Us

The Better World Market is an online marketplace established in 2019 that provides a platform for ecologically sound, mindful small businesses and makers to share their mission and sell their products.

We believe social good is the main ingredient in operating a successful, mindful business, and we want them on our platform! You can check out our marketplace at, www.shopbetterworld.com

Goal

However, when COVID hit, small businesses around the United States (and the world) struggled enormously, forcing many to close for good. In an effort to help small businesses, we are hoping to crowdfund our new project dedicated to helping small businesses through monthly subscription boxes!

How it Works

We are launching two subscription boxes that you can choose from, one containing a scented candle, and one with two scented soaps. You can also opt to purchase both!

In each box, you will learn about the business you’ve received products from and you will also receive a discount code. With that code, you can purchase more products from that business at a discount at www.shopbetterworld.com

And did we mention the trees you’re planting…?

Planting Trees

For every box sent out, we plant a tree! The Better World Market has joined the family of companies that support the non-profit organization, One Tree Planted. One Tree Planted is an environmental organization dedicated to, well, planting trees! Trees are so important in helping reduce the effects of climate change, as they absorb harmful pollutants and release clean oxygen for us to breathe!

Environmental Commitments

There will be no plastic in any of the boxes you receive. All products will be vegan, organic, and free of palm oil and animal product. The ingredients in every product are of the highest quality with zero negative impacts on the planet.

Risks and challenges

Our goal is to have your products arrive the second week of each month. Due to COVID-19, USPS delays, and potential audience size, products may arrive towards the end of each month, rather than the second week.

Other Ways You Can Help

Be sure to follow us on our Instagram @betterworldbio and/or Like us on Facebook!

story:
Eco Bee Box - Mini Hive

Eco Bee Box - Mini Hive

Sustain-able backyard beekeeping has not existed....until now. Our American-made, mini hive is a natural easy way to raise bees and queens. This universal system works with any style of beekeeping equipment. Easy for children, beginners, or advanced beekeepers to use, the mini hive is an excellent way to learn, raise and sustain bee colonies. Mini hives are the missing link in beekeeping.


Problem:

Sustaining colonies from season to season is a problem all beekeepers face. Some colonies will fail in the first year while others excel. The key to success  is duplicating local survivor colonies that have desirable, familiar traits.  The mini hive encourages this kind of sustainable beekeeping.

Every bee colony contains bacteria and microscopic life that lives in a delicate balance with the bees. Each hive has its own unique, dynamic ecosystem. When teaching beekeepers to create new colonies, I show how to copy and transfer the the ecosystem to the new hive with the comb and bees. When a colony is joined with a queen at random, common with bee packages that include a queen from a different colony, the tolerance of two separate ecosystems can be difficult for the bees and the queen.

Solution: 

The key to sustainable beekeeping is learning how to produce a locally grown queen who is adapted to the conditions in your area. Weak colonies get sick, abscond, swarm, and are attacked by other insects and rodents. A knowledgeable beekeeper can assist a colony in trouble immediately with a queen raised naturally with her working ecosystem. Using a mini hive makes providing a queen to a struggling colony simple. We're currently working on raising money for educational materials to teach backyard beekeepers how to raise queens and care for bees. These materials will include professional videos and will be available online, anywhere in the world, whenever a beekeeper needs them.

The Eco Bee Box mini hive is an inexpensive, attractive, low-maintenance urban beehive. Small bee hives are common in nature and are good for bees because they make it easier to regulate the environment inside the hive such as  temperature, humidity, and defense. Mini hives can be suspended from a tree, placed in your garden, or used as support for your larger colonies.

An example of supporting a larger hive is this image showing how a mini frame can be used in a top--bar application.  The mini frame successfully introduced a capped queen to a hive that was killing every queen we added.  This mini frame also strengthened the usually weak comb frame.


Application:

An explanation of the mini hive. Learn to create your own second generation queen from a colony with traits you know and has which has survived the first year test.  Use this queen as you need in your apiary, and the mini hive will create a third generation queen naturally.  This way your queen has a pedigree you can trace. Colonies that survive more than a year or thrive without treatments are the survivor colonies that a beekeeper should focus on, rather than the colonies that are lost.  The mini hive is a tiny breeding ground similar to what is found in nature and is an excellent way to create a new, second generation colony. With the right educational tools all beekeepers can raise their own local queens.

One advantage of the Eco Bee Box mini hive is the ability to harvest honey without an extractor. Simply remove the frame from the hive, place the comb in a plastic bag, squish it, let the honey and the comb settle, and then drain the honey. 100% natural and local. Another of the unique features of the mini hive is the speed which bees produce comb honey. This makes it easy for people with allergies to remove capped honey with allergy benefits during their allergy season, knowing that it created from local pollens.

$50 Perk is a Single Mini - use to start a queen, teach, display.


$125 Perk is a 3 box mini, ready for bees.


$150 Mini Hive with 4 boxes and observation window. 


$400 Copper Mini Hive with many carved panels, English top, tree hanger, and more.

Eco Bee Box mini hives have been sent all over the world, and to every state in the United States.

Help me launch a series of educational videos focused on the following topics: teaching new beekeepers how to start; teaching beekeepers how to be sustainable; and teach villages and back yard beekeepers how to raise their own bees and make natural comb honey.  With education bees will be saved and we will know how to interact with them in an earth-conscious manner.    


Mini Hive ($50 perk)  on top a comb box ($75) , showing size.  This comb box is the size of a standard beehive, the mini on top is a 1/4 size.  The frame of honey on top the box is the way I distribute honey.  Consumer can cut it out, place in a baggy, squish, let settle, pop holes  with a tooth pick and let strain. 

Stainless steel locking clilps are great for hold boxes together and keeping lids and bottoms attched.  


T-shirt supporting beekeeping.  Eco Bee Box on the front and sleeves and beekeeping image on the rear.

hive will create a third generation queen naturally.  This way your queen has a 
pedigree you can trace. Colonies that survive more than a 
year or thrive without treatments are the survivor colonies that a beekeeper 
should focus on, rather than the colonies that are lost.  The mini hive is a tiny breeding ground similar to what is 
found in nature and is an excellent way to create a new, second generation 
colony. With the right educational tools all beekeepers can raise their own local queens. One advantage of the Eco Bee Box mini hive is the ability to harvest 
honey without an extractor. Simply remove the frame from the hive, place the comb in a plastic bag, 
squish it, let the honey and the comb settle, and then drain the honey. 
100% natural and 
local. Another of the unique features of the mini hive is the speed
which bees produce comb honey. This makes it easy for people with allergies to remove capped honey 
with allergy benefits during their allergy season, knowing that it created from local pollens. 
$50 Perk is a Single Mini - use to start a queen, teach, display.$125 Perk is a 3 box mini, ready for bees.$150 Mini Hive with 4 boxes and observation window.  $400 Copper Mini Hive with many carved panels, English top, tree hanger, and more. Eco Bee 
Box mini hives have been sent all over the world, and to every state in the 
United States. 
Help me launch a series of educational videos focused on the following topics: teaching new beekeepers how to start; teaching beekeepers how to be sustainable; and teach villages and back yard beekeepers how to raise their own bees and make natural comb honey.  With education bees will be saved and we will know how to interact with them in an earth-conscious manner.    Mini Hive ($50 perk)  on top a comb box ($75) , showing size.  This comb box is the size of a standard beehive, the mini on top is a 1/4 size.  The frame of honey on top the box is the way I distribute honey.  Consumer can cut it out, place in a baggy, squish, let settle, pop holes  with a tooth pick and let strain. Stainless steel locking clilps are great for hold boxes together and keeping lids and bottoms attched.  T-shirt supporting beekeeping.  Eco Bee Box on the front and sleeves and beekeeping image on the rear.

story:
The Challenge

Comprising 44% of the world’s forested area, tropical forests are the basis for the livelihoods of approximately two billion rural poor across the globe. Additionally, deforestation accounts for approximately 18% of all anthropogenically generated greenhouse gas emissions and is seen as a relatively low-cost target for emissions reduction.  Reversing the trend in tropical forest loss and degradation through reforestation provides a major tool for global climate change mitigation, biodiversity conservation, and poverty alleviation.

What Works

One of the first steps towards successful reforestation is healthy seedlings.  At the University of Idaho’s Center for Forest Nursery and Seedling Research, a team of graduate students has been looking at various ways to produce high quality seedlings in the most economically viable ways.  By focusing on some of the utmost basic premises behind producing healthy trees we have come up with various growing alternatives for use in areas where access to high-end nursery equipment is not possible.

 


The focus of this project has been to examine the quality of plant roots in response to various container and media types.  The science behind focusing on plant root structure is based on the plant’s ability to seek out and acquire water and nutrients once it has been planted in the environment.  The better equipped these roots are to searching for food the more likely they are to survive.


We need your support!

One of the major goals of this research project is to share what we would learn and we have learned a lot!

We would like to take our knowledge and some supplies to one area of the world in particular that has suffered greatly from deforestation. 

Over the last few years, researchers at the University of Idaho have cultivated several connections to grassroots organizations in Haiti.  These organizations are passionate about the health of their people and are aware of the connection between human health and forest health.

For the last five centuries the forests of Haiti have been cut down to make room for farms, to be sold as timber and to serve as fuel for cooking.  Of the 60% of land that was once forested in this beautiful country roughly 2% remains today. 


With the money we hope to raise via this campaign we will purchase the necessary supplies to help native Haitian nurseries gain a foothold in quality tree production.  With these supplies we will build two nurseries in Haiti.  The nurseries will be equipped with all of the basic nursery supplies including a water filtration system, watering cans, hard-sided growing containers and controlled release fertilizers.  Additionally, we have fostered a partnership with a local non-profit organization that will provide high quality compost for seedling growth and nutrition.

Furthermore, while we are in Haiti we will be holding several workshops for interested farmers and nursery practitioners on the most exciting aspects of our research findings.

story:
Travel with Lulu, 15, and me, an investigative journalist devoted to preserving our world

Nancie L. Katz has been a traveler and a journalist since her teens, but the places she and her family have enjoyed and appreciated the most have not been major, expansive resorts with tons of tourists and amenities, operated by large international companies that spirit visitor dollars out of the country. 

Our favorites have been the locally owned lodges, simple but sufficient, right on the beach or the mountaintop,  where the owner - born and raised in the country or village - cooks you the day's catch from fellow fisherman on a grill right on the ocean or a river and tells you about his or her life and family.

We love meeting people from around the world and find richness in every corner. 

But, while visiting Africa and other parts of the world, we were disturbed that so much of the dollars spent by visitors - even in eco-tourism - leave the countries where they were spent and go to corporations operating large enterprises. While these travel destinations do hire local residents, many of their approaches are not sustainable or enrich the lives of those born and raised there.

So, Nancie and Lulu, 15, a high school sophomore,  will travel to Guatemala - our first trip for a series on places you can go even from a cruise ship - and write, video and photograph. We'll tell you how to be hosted by local residents and help them make a living from tourism, preserve their precious environment, save them and their children and even have an impact on immigration to the United States because they can survive - not by cutting down trees from a rainforest or fishing in overfished waters - but by sharing their joy in their surroundings with you!

Do you want to be part of the solution? Help even the poorest people in the world preserve our oceans, save our rain forests and all our natural wonders for generations to come? Help us help the world?

Please support Lulu and me as we travel to Guatemala, our first in a series of adventures to be turned into a book, so we can share with you just how you can do these trips, even if you're 87 years old and aren't as mobile as you used to be!

These trips will be for all ages, and all kinds of families. 

Say, you're going on a Caribbean cruise which stops at Santo Tomas de Castilla, Izabal? Let us create an excursion for everyone - from a young mom with an infant to an adventurous teen to a youthful globetrotter  to grandparents who have trouble walking - so they can afford to explore the beauty of our world - and the delicious food!

And give back at the same time!

What We Need & What You Get

You will be funding: 
  • our airfare
  • purchase of crafts from the local residents, mainly from artisans of Mayan descent so we can support them, education for their families  and communities
  • Prints of photos for local children we give as gifts to them
  • A photo book to send back to delight children and families we visit
  • a chance to highlight the fine work of non-governmental charities like the MAR Fund, protecting Caribbean coral reefs and our oceans; FUNDAECO, sustainably  managing Guatelama's stunning natural resources and improving the people's quality of life. Their photos are on our site.
  • a chance to publicize charities focused on saving children and girls like Casa Guatemala and Ak-Tenamit
  • The first chapter - Guatemala - of a book to be written by Lulu and me about where families can go to give back to the world - sustainably!

The Impact

Around the world, desperate families send loved one  to countries like the U.S and Europe to make money because they can't find a way to survive in their home villages. Many migrants don't really want to leave, but have no other choice.
You can help us help them - especially these days with heightened tension over U.S. and European immigration.  Impoverished locals don't  want to destroy their environments by cutting down trees to grow food or overfishing. They're hungry. 
Please directly give them a way to make a living and preserve our world for generations to come. Your dollars can help us publicize programs that help parents keep their children near, educate sons and daughters for a better tomorrow, save boys and girls from being trafficked for sex or labor, create jobs that preserve - not destroy - nature, actively empower folks to save a way of life they cherish, which we too would love to visit!
Here's who we are:
  • Nancie L. Katz is a veteran investigative journalist focused on human rights, who has reported all over the world for major publications. For 11 years, Nancie covered education and courts for the New York Daily News. Before then, she was based in Jerusalem covering the Middle East for United Press International and Newsday, and in Latin America, Asia and Italy. She has also reported for UPI from Boise, Idaho and Jerusalem; and from Rome for Inter Press News Service, the Daily American, just to name a few. Her work has been published in the Washington Post, Chicago Tribune, Dallas Morning News, San Franciso Chronicle, Fort Lauderdale Sun-Sentinel, Atlanta Journal-Constitution, Boston Globe, Glamour and New York Magazine and more; plus she was an editor for  National Public Radio on the foreign desk and for Morning Edition.
  • Lulu is a sophomore in a New York City high school - a teen who loves to sing and travel and is passionate about feminism and helping girls - who you may see playing music with children in the middle of the rainforest of Guatemala and on its Caribbean coast!

Risks & Challenges

  • American friends keep telling us it's dangerous in Guatemala, but we'll be guided by local leaders of NGOs.
  • They will share exotic places where YOU can visit and enjoy natural beauty and lovely people. Your dollars will empower them to create sustainable livelihoods and save their children and, particularly, girls.
  • The beautiful photos come from FUNDAECO!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, please just tell everyone you know and see if they can give a little... to go very far! 

  • Please share on Facebook
  • Please  get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks so much from Nancie and Lulu and our friends in Guatemala.

story:
You Can Make A Difference

The Cargo Carousel for Greener, Cheaper, Faster and Safer Shipping

Every product at your favorite retailers is shipped there through the supply chain. Your financial support will help build a new invention that will cut the pollution caused by trucks in the supply chain by as much as half and replace all the wooden pallets product sit on during transit with recycled aluminum modules, cutting deforestation by as much as 50%.

Your contribution will go towards building a Cargo Carousel System prototype so the supply chain industry can see first hand how this new invention will dramatically help the environment, reduce costs and streamline shipping processes.

Without your help we may need to seek corporate funding and the corporation could keep the Cargo Carousel System to themselves, increasing their profits but, not reducing the carbon footprint for the entire supply chain and all the products you buy. 

The next step is yours... Make a contribution today and share on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Google plus and by email because it's good for our environment.


Greener, Cheaper, Faster and Safer

See below how your contribution will help make the supply chain greener, cheaper, faster and safer so the products we all buy have a smaller carbon footprint.

Greener: Reduce Deforestation by as much as 50%

The production of wooden pallets alone consumes as much hardwood in the US, every year, as all other uses combined.  Yes, every year up to half of all the trees cut down are used to make pallets!  Your contribution will help build a prototype to show the supply chain industry how they can eliminate the need for wooden pallets and still save money bringing products to your favorite retailer.

 

Cheaper: Ride Sharing for Products 

Eliminating partially filled trucks has proven to save 35% in shipping costs and reduces greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions even further.

We've replaced pallets with opaque, closed, lockable and sealable modules. These secure modules allow different shippers to share the same truck without worrying about competitors prying eyes, encouraging collaborative or consolidated transport for smaller shipments in both the supply and reverse chains. 

Faster: Giant Vending Machine 

Adding small Cargo Carousels inside full scale Cargo Carousel modules with a digital keypad for access creates automated customer pick-up, like a giant vending machine anywhere the Cargo Carousel is positioned such as in a parking lot or even facing “inside” a store, high-rise or mall.  Pick up your order when it suits your schedule or to avoid lines.

The Cargo Carousel modules would be pre-stocked with customers orders and swapped out as orders are picked up. These vending machines could be placed throughout the city so customers travel less to retrieve their orders reducing time and greenhouse gas emissions even further.

Safer: Dock Free Warehouses 

 

The Cargo Carousel System could eliminate whole distribution centers in exchange for ground level, weatherproof, temperature-controllable containers in smaller, multiple, secure, fenced yards. With no need for docks, dock plates and dock levelers the new distribution center will be safer for employees to use. Distribution centers would also be smaller and closer to the consumer reducing their impact on the environment.

Greener: Reduce Packaging

Modules in the Cargo Carousel can be built as actual retail display fixtures with merchandise already in the fixture to “swap” out with empty fixtures in the store to minimize handling and reduce waste from excess packaging that would otherwise go into landfills.

Cheaper: Double Storage Capacity 

 

 

Stacking Cargo Carousel containers side-by-side in a warehouse creates automated deep storage and retrieval that offers twice the space utilization of regular racking or shelving as it minimizes the need for all the aisles that are required for forklifts to maneuver. New warehouses will be half as large and existing warehouses will store twice as much further reducing warehousing's costs and environmental impact.

 

Yes, you can make an entire industry transform the wasteful way it brings products to your favorite retailers.  Go green by choosing a perk listed on the right for your contribution!

Invite others to join you in helping get products to us all that are greener, faster, cheaper and safer (Feel free to use the links on the left)


$5 Gets You Recognized Forever

Your Name For The World To See

 

Show the world your commitment to improving our environment. Every $5 + contributor will have their name right on the exterior siding of the new Cargo Carousel System prototype. The world will know who helped make this project possible! Contribute today before this limited space is full.

Get Featured

Take a photo next to your name on the Cargo Carousel System when we come to a trade show near you and we'll feature your photo on the webpage! The Cargo Carousel prototype will be on display continuously as we travel down the highway and again at trade shows around the world. Our goal is to expand our markets overseas so every $5+ contributor from all around the world has an opportunity to see their name permanently imprinted on the Cargo Carousel System prototype.

Be a Part of History

The Cargo Carousel System’s impact will be felt for years to come. So much so that maybe the Smithsonian will even want the original Cargo Carousel System prototype for display... ... make sure you get your name on the prototype just in-case!

Investor List

We're not ready to offer equity now but, for those individuals whose contribution is $100 or more, your name will go on our “Investor List” and you will receive advanced notification and first right of refusal regarding our equity offerings.

 

More Ways to Make a Difference

Every contribution you make, whether $1 or $100, and every time you share the excitement, your efforts will multiply, helping to dramatically reduce the carbon footprint on all the products you buy.

Share with your family, friends, acquaintances and co-workers, show them that they too can reduce deforestation and greenhouse gas emissions and make a dramatic difference with you. (Feel free to use the links on the left)

  • Get the word out by email.
  • Post a message on your Facebook page.
  • Better yet, share the campaign video.
  • Tweet a link to our Indiegogo page.
  • Wear the T-shirt or button you added the logo graphics to and start a conversation
  • Visit our blog and add an encouraging comment

Glen’s Journey

Glen started his career in the engineering field back in the 70's when design was still done on a drafting table. When CAD (computer assisted design) came about Glen realized that he would have to go back to school either to learn CAD or another career. He chose accounting to improve his position in the "business" end of the engineering field and spent six years at night school in his pursuit (Glen understands perseverance).

Fast forward and we find Glen working on the design of a distribution center for a major retailing outfit in eastern Canada. It was here that Glen discovered the inner workings of supply chains and he was amazed at how antiquated and inefficient they were. Empty trucks lined up at the security gate, engines idling, waiting to pick up their loads and even more of them leaving empty after their deliveries. How could this be? Huge retailing operations with warehouses bigger than a million square feet each who are actually shipping more air than merchandise! With all their money and brainpower and this is the best they could do? Unbelievable! There has to be a better way. That's when Glen decided to go into business for himself.

Glen Goes Green

In the early years before eBay, Overstock.com and the like had come into existence, Glen started a company selling distressed inventory from his own 46,000 square foot warehouse. Distressed inventory are products that haven’t been sold in the retail stores and were being sent straight to landfills. He was being green by keeping literally tons of products out of landfills.

It was during this time that he learned the ropes of the supply and reverse chains and figured out a smarter way to move merchandise in both the supply and reverse chains at the same time! In 2012 Glen changed his focus and the Cargo Carousel System was born.

 

Carmen Goes Green

Which brings us to Glen’s wife, Carmen Munholland. When Glen explained this concept to her, she had a lot of questions. Such as... "Is the supply chain really unsustainable? Is it something they can adopt easily? Does it make their job easier? Is it cost effective? Can we add a Cargo Carousel System inside a Cargo Carousel module? And the most important one; "Does it exemplify Corporate Social Responsibility?” Glen's answer to all of these questions was a resounding "YES!"

 

We Did Our Research

To verify this, we conducted market research on competitive analysis, market availability, costs to market and market penetration.

Then we focused on:

  • product definition research and analysis on end user
  • customer requirements (product life span, functionality strength, rigidity, flexibility, look, feel and performance)
  • product cost per volume
  • sales channels
  • timing requirements
  • human factors/intuitive interface
  • expected use
  • safety
  • failure mode and effects analysis
  • warranty
  • certification
  • social concerns
  • and manufacturing (cost, time, material, size, weight, complexity)

Keep It Independent

From our research we ascertained the costs involved in bringing this radically new idea to the market. We’re also very aware that if we seek corporate funding the corporation may keep the Cargo Carousel System to themselves, increasing their profits but, not reducing the carbon footprint on all the products you buy. We continued our research and discovered crowdfunding as well as government grants supportive of our project.

 

We Joined a Revolution

We looked everywhere to see if a similar product was already available (it’s not), applied for a patent and found other people and organizations that were trying to solve the challenges of a sustainable supply chain too.

We learned about the Physical Internet, Circular Economy, Modulushca Project, MetroLab Network and The Internet of Things. We found ourselves right in the middle of a supply chain revolution with smart, influential and concerned people wanting to make the supply chain sustainable. And the Cargo Carousel System fits right in! In fact the Cargo Carousel System will physically connect these great sustainability concepts with all the manufacturers, trucking companies, distributors and retailers as they move, store, track and sell products.

We all agree that the old supply chain system needs to be made sustainable for our environment.  Your contribution will help make it happen.

 

Perks Go Green

Wearable perks are a fun idea but, offering t-shirts or baseball caps we ship to you would only add to greenhouse gas emissions. Since recycling and supporting a sustainable supply chain is what we’re about we decided on "printables".

Large printable

We’ll email our trademarked logo to you as a printable. You print it onto transfer paper and iron it onto a t-shirt, hoodie, etc of your choice. Recycle a plain t-shirt into a "Sustainable Supply Chain" t-shirt.

Small printable

We’ll also email a smaller printable to slip into a campaign button/pin.

The Numbers...

 

Calculated Risks and Challenges

To manage risk, we conducted an exhaustive study of the industry for the Cargo Carousel System. We’ve also conferred with academia and government and received support and validation for our idea.

Of special note:

  • Dr. Ben Montreuil author of The Physical Internet and past Chair of the Canadian Inter-university Research Center on Enterprise Logistics and Transportation.


  • Innovate Calgary, an offshoot of the University of Calgary.
  • Bill Pawluk, President of Convertible Trailer Manufacturing and a veteran of business development in an industry that is very similar to ours.
  • Alberta Government support through the Southern Alberta Institute of Technology.

 

Our Personal Investment

Through the journey, our idea has received a lot of support. It’s what the industry needs now and we’re the first ones with this new technology. We've already invested 3 years of full-time research and over $115,000 of our own dollars because we believe the benefits to the industry, and especially for our environment, are worth the risks.

We’re at the point where a prototype is needed to move the project from conception to reality and radically improve the way retailers get products to you.

Make a difference.  Contribute and help dramatically reduce the harm the huge supply chain industry causes to our environment.

Use of Funds

This may seem like a lot of money for one prototype but, most inventors lose their shirts or their invention to a better funded source (i.e. corporations) because they didn’t do their due diligence and find out all the costs involved in getting a new technology to market.  Costs, such as patent filing for well over a hundred countries around the world can add up quickly.

The funds raised will go towards:

  • Grant application fees – SAIT        2500
  • IRAP Government grant – 1         25000
  • IRAP Government grant – 2         75000
  • International patent                      195000
  • Production engineering               155000
  • Marketing                                           35000
  • Admin/Social Media                       55000
  • Legal                                                     65000
  • Project management                      50000
  • ISO container                                       5000
  • Semi-tractor/trailer lease            42000
  • Trade show tour                               95000
  • Total                                                  799500
  • Less: Grant funding                    (400000)
  • Balance of funding required 399500

 

The Good, the Bad and the Ugly

There is always the risk that this campaign may not reach its goal but, we have a plan of action to ensure we can build a prototype through individual and government funding. However your contribution will help insure the Cargo Carousel System is made available to the entire supply chain sooner so all the products you buy have a smaller carbon footprint.

Timeline

2013

  • conducted market research
  • conducted product research and analysis
  • created concept drawings
  • submitted U.S. provisional patent (approved)

2014

  • developed business plan
  • refined conceptual design
  • applied additional innovations
  • Dr. Montreuil joins Board of Advisors
  • Jonathan Simpson joins Board of Advisors

2015

  • developed rendering drawings
  • Memorandum of Understanding for new consortium is drafted to join the MetroLab Network*
  • Amy S. Chan, Courtney Burton and Katrina join the Board of Advisors
  • Plan and launch Indiegogo campaign

* A consortium of academics and thought leaders that will allow us to collaborate with “multiple” city/university members of the network to bring the Physical Internet into reality.

 

After the Campaign:

Nov 2015 to Aug 2016

  • Create Contributors webpage on our website for pictures, updates, and comments
  • Begin prototype development at Southern Alberta Institute of Technology.
  • Submit grant applications to IRAP for prototype development and commercialization. (Grants require that we contribute 25% of the grant values.)
  • Advance rendering drawings to production engineering stage.
  • Submit international patent application.
  • Submit Request for Proposal (RFP) to Dematic and Daifuku Webb for production manufacturing.
  • Sign lease agreement with Penske for a heavy duty semi-tractor/trailer.
  • Develop trade show schedule for the U.S. and Canada to present the Cargo Carousel System to the supply chain and transportation industries including members of the MetroLab Network.
  • Launch Cargo Carousel System prototype.

Sep 2016 to Mar 2017

  • North American trade show tour to showcase the Cargo Carousel System and to share the names of all of our supporters while driving down the highway and at each of the trade shows. All supporters with contributions of $100.00 or more will receive an advanced trade show schedule; all other supporters will receive updates as we travel.
  • Capitalization table, term sheet, prospectus and offering memorandum developed for first round financing towards full scale manufacturing and production.
  • Invitations sent for equity funding to Investor List contributors 

 

The next step is yours...
Contribute now because empty trucks are killing us!

 

* Ballot E. and F. Fontane, "Rendement et efficience du transport: un nouvel indicateur de performance," Revue Française de Gestion Industrielle, vol. 27, 41-55, 2008.
story_txt:
You Can Make A Difference

The Cargo Carousel for Greener, Cheaper, Faster and Safer Shipping
Every product at your favorite retailers is shipped there through the supply chain. Your financial support will help build a new invention that will cut the pollution caused by trucks in the supply chain by as much as half and replace all the wooden pallets product sit on during transit with recycled aluminum modules, cutting deforestation by as much as 50%.
Your contribution will go towards building a Cargo Carousel System prototype so the supply chain industry can see first hand how this new invention will dramatically help the environment, reduce costs and streamline shipping processes.
Without your help we may need to seek corporate funding  and the corporation could keep the Cargo Carousel System to themselves, increasing their profits but, not reducing the carbon footprint for the entire supply chain and all the products you buy. The next step is yours... Make a contribution today and share on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Google plus and by email because it's good for our environment. 
Greener, Cheaper, Faster and Safer
See below how your contribution will help make the supply chain greener, cheaper, faster and safer so the products we all buy have a smaller carbon footprint.
Greener: Reduce Deforestation by as much as 50%
The production of wooden pallets alone consumes as much hardwood in the US, every year, as all other uses combined.  Yes, every year up to half of all the trees cut down are used to make pallets!  Your contribution will help build a prototype to show the supply chain industry how they can eliminate the need for wooden pallets and still save money bringing products to your favorite retailer.


 
Cheaper: Ride Sharing for Products 
Eliminating partially filled trucks has proven to save 35% in shipping costs and reduces greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions even further.
We've replaced pallets with opaque, closed, lockable and sealable modules. These secure modules allow different shippers to share the same truck without worrying about competitors prying eyes, encouraging collaborative or consolidated transport for smaller shipments in both the supply and reverse chains. 


Faster: Giant Vending Machine 

Adding small Cargo Carousels inside full scale Cargo Carousel modules with a digital keypad for access creates automated customer pick-up, like a giant vending machine anywhere the Cargo Carousel is positioned such as in a parking lot or even facing “inside” a store, high-rise or mall.  Pick up your order when it suits your schedule or to avoid lines.
The Cargo Carousel modules would be pre-stocked with customers orders and swapped out as orders are picked up. These vending machines could be placed throughout the city so customers travel less to retrieve their orders reducing time and greenhouse gas emissions even further.

Safer: Dock Free Warehouses 


 
The Cargo Carousel System could eliminate whole distribution centers in exchange for ground level, weatherproof, temperature-controllable containers in smaller, multiple, secure, fenced yards. With no need for docks, dock plates and dock levelers the new distribution center will be safer for employees to use. Distribution centers would also be smaller and closer to the consumer reducing their impact on the environment.

Greener: Reduce Packaging
Modules in the Cargo Carousel can be built as actual retail display fixtures with merchandise already in the fixture to “swap” out with empty fixtures in the store to minimize handling and reduce waste from excess packaging that would otherwise go into landfills.
Cheaper: Double Storage Capacity 
 

 
Stacking Cargo Carousel containers side-by-side in a warehouse creates automated deep storage and retrieval that offers twice the space utilization of regular racking or shelving as it minimizes the need for all the aisles that are required for forklifts to maneuver. New warehouses will be half as large and existing warehouses will store twice as much further reducing warehousing's costs and environmental impact.
 


Yes, you can make an entire industry transform the wasteful way it brings products to your favorite retailers.  Go green by choosing a perk listed on the right for your contribution!
Invite others to join you in helping get products to us all that are greener, faster, cheaper and safer (Feel free to use the links on the left)

$5 Gets You Recognized Forever
Your Name For The World To See



 
Show the world your commitment to improving our environment. Every $5 + contributor will have their name right on the exterior siding of the new Cargo Carousel System prototype. The world will know who helped make this project possible! Contribute today before this limited space is full.
Get Featured
Take a photo next to your name on the Cargo Carousel System when we come to a trade show near you and we'll feature your photo on the webpage! The Cargo Carousel prototype will be on display continuously as we travel down the highway and again at trade shows around the world. Our goal is to expand our markets overseas so every $5+ contributor from all around the world has an opportunity to see their name permanently imprinted on the Cargo Carousel System prototype.
Be a Part of History
The Cargo Carousel System’s impact will be felt for years to come. So much so that maybe the Smithsonian will even want the original Cargo Carousel System prototype for display... ... make sure you get your name on the prototype just in-case!
Investor List
We're not ready to offer equity now but, for those individuals whose contribution is $100 or more, your name will go on our “Investor List” and you will receive advanced notification and first right of refusal regarding our equity offerings.
 
More Ways to Make a Difference
Every contribution you make, whether $1 or $100, and every time you share the excitement, your efforts will multiply, helping to dramatically reduce the carbon footprint on all the products you buy.
Share with your family, friends, acquaintances and co-workers, show them that they too can reduce deforestation and greenhouse gas emissions and make a dramatic difference with you. (Feel free to use the links on the left)

Get the word out by email.
Post a message on your Facebook page.
Better yet, share the campaign video.
Tweet a link to our Indiegogo page.
Wear the T-shirt or button you added the logo graphics to and start a conversation
Visit our blog and add an encouraging comment



Glen’s Journey
Glen started his career in the engineering field back in the 70's when design was still done on a drafting table. When CAD (computer assisted design) came about Glen realized that he would have to go back to school either to learn CAD or another career. He chose accounting to improve his position in the "business" end of the engineering field and spent six years at night school in his pursuit (Glen understands perseverance).
Fast forward and we find Glen working on the design of a distribution center for a major retailing outfit in eastern Canada. It was here that Glen discovered the inner workings of supply chains and he was amazed at how antiquated and inefficient they were. Empty trucks lined up at the security gate, engines idling, waiting to pick up their loads and even more of them leaving empty after their deliveries. How could this be? Huge retailing operations with warehouses bigger than a million square feet each who are actually shipping more air than merchandise! With all their money and brainpower and this is the best they could do? Unbelievable! There has to be a better way. That's when Glen decided to go into business for himself.
Glen Goes Green

In the early years before eBay, Overstock.com and the like had come into existence, Glen started a company selling distressed inventory from his own 46,000 square foot warehouse. Distressed inventory are products that haven’t been sold in the retail stores and were being sent straight to landfills. He was being green by keeping literally tons of products out of landfills.
It was during this time that he learned the ropes of the supply and reverse chains and figured out a smarter way to move merchandise in both the supply and reverse chains at the same time! In 2012 Glen changed his focus and the Cargo Carousel System was born.
 

Carmen Goes Green
Which brings us to Glen’s wife, Carmen Munholland. When Glen explained this concept to her, she had a lot of questions. Such as... "Is the supply chain really unsustainable? Is it something they can adopt easily? Does it make their job easier? Is it cost effective?  Can we add a Cargo Carousel System inside a Cargo Carousel module? And the most important one; "Does it exemplify Corporate Social Responsibility?” Glen's answer to all of these questions was a resounding "YES!"
 
We Did Our Research

To verify this, we conducted market research on competitive analysis, market availability, costs to market and market penetration.
Then we focused on:

product definition research and analysis on end user
customer requirements (product life span, functionality strength, rigidity, flexibility, look, feel and performance)
product cost per volume
sales channels
timing requirements
human factors/intuitive interface
expected use
safety
failure mode and effects analysis
warranty
certification
social concerns

and manufacturing (cost, time, material, size, weight, complexity)


Keep It Independent
From our research we ascertained the costs involved in bringing this radically new idea to the market. We’re also very aware that if we seek corporate funding the corporation may keep the Cargo Carousel System to themselves, increasing their profits but, not reducing the carbon footprint on all the products you buy. We continued our research and discovered crowdfunding as well as government grants supportive of our project.

 
We Joined a Revolution
We looked everywhere to see if a similar product was already available (it’s not), applied for a patent and found other people and organizations that were trying to solve the challenges of a sustainable supply chain too.
We learned about the Physical Internet, Circular Economy, Modulushca Project, MetroLab Network and The Internet of Things. We found ourselves right in the middle of a supply chain revolution with smart, influential and concerned people wanting to make the supply chain sustainable. And the Cargo Carousel System fits right in! In fact the Cargo Carousel System will physically connect these great sustainability concepts with all the manufacturers, trucking companies, distributors and retailers as they move, store, track and sell products.
We all agree that the old supply chain system needs to be made sustainable for our environment.  Your contribution will help make it happen.

 
Perks Go Green
Wearable perks are a fun idea but, offering t-shirts or baseball caps we ship to you would only add to greenhouse gas emissions. Since recycling and supporting a sustainable supply chain is what we’re about we decided on "printables".
Large printable
We’ll email our trademarked logo to you as a printable. You print it onto transfer paper and iron it onto a t-shirt, hoodie, etc of your choice. Recycle a plain t-shirt into a "Sustainable Supply Chain" t-shirt.
Small printable
We’ll also email a smaller printable to slip into a campaign button/pin.




The Numbers...

 
Calculated Risks and Challenges
To manage risk, we conducted an exhaustive study of the industry for the Cargo Carousel System. We’ve also conferred with academia and government and received support and validation for our idea.
Of special note:

Dr. Ben Montreuil author of The Physical Internet and past Chair of the Canadian Inter-university Research Center on Enterprise Logistics and Transportation.



Innovate Calgary, an offshoot of the University of Calgary.
Bill Pawluk, President of Convertible Trailer Manufacturing and a veteran of business development in an industry that is very similar to ours.
Alberta Government support through the Southern Alberta Institute of Technology.

 
Our Personal Investment
Through the journey, our idea has received a lot of support. It’s what the industry needs now and we’re the first ones with this new technology. We've already invested 3 years of full-time research and over $115,000 of our own dollars because we believe the benefits to the industry, and especially for our environment, are worth the risks.
We’re at the point where a prototype is needed to move the project from conception to reality and radically improve the way retailers get products to you.
Make a difference.  Contribute and help dramatically reduce the harm the huge supply chain industry causes to our environment.
Use of Funds
This may seem like a lot of money for one prototype but, most inventors lose their shirts or their invention to a better funded source (i.e. corporations) because they didn’t do their due diligence and find out all the costs involved in getting a new technology to market.  Costs, such as patent filing for well over a hundred countries around the world can add up quickly.

The funds raised will go towards:

Grant application fees – SAIT        2500
IRAP Government grant – 1         25000
IRAP Government grant – 2         75000
International patent                      195000
Production engineering               155000
Marketing                                           35000
Admin/Social Media                       55000
Legal                                                     65000
Project management                      50000
ISO container                                       5000
Semi-tractor/trailer lease            42000
Trade show tour                               95000

Total                                                  799500

Less: Grant funding                    (400000)

Balance of funding required 399500


 
The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
There is always the risk that this campaign may not reach its goal but, we have a plan of action to ensure we can build a prototype through individual and government funding. However your contribution will help insure the Cargo Carousel System is made available to the entire supply chain sooner so all the products you buy have a smaller carbon footprint.
Timeline

conducted market research
conducted product research and analysis
created concept drawings
submitted U.S. provisional patent (approved)

2014

developed business plan
refined conceptual design
applied additional innovations

story:
Who are we?

Yiddish Farm is a visionary organization that teaches Yiddish and builds community through organic farming, rigorous classes and Jewish living. It was founded by two friends that had the same dream at the same time. Watch the video to learn more!

What is the project?

Yiddish Farm needs your help to construct an eco-friendly state-of-the-art drip-tape irrigation system in our upper field.  Designed by experts from the United States Department of Agriculture, this system allows us to increase production while conserving water and protecting our soil from erosion.

Why is this important?

•  Sustainable farming is a pillar of Yiddish Farm and one of the most pressing issues of our time

•  Our current system of irrigation wastes water and is overly labor-intensive

•  Without necessary improvements, we are limited in the scale and variety of crops we can produce

• Yiddish Farm's numerous unused acres could grow vegetables and berries for nearby population centers in New York and New Jersey

•  If properly implemented, Yiddish Farm is eligible to receive a grant from the National Resource Conservation Service for this project

• Without constructing a sustainable agricultural system, Yiddish Farm cannot fulfill its vision of building community and learning Yiddish through farming 


Please donate to this project and help Yiddish Farm save time, money, labor, water and soil. 

And don't forget to spread the word!

story:
NotOneMore is an Non-Profit Organisation that supports Frontline Environmental Defenders. We specialise in supporting individuals or small organisations, who are at risk when defending the environment. We support them to be safe but also continue their fight.

This campaign is to support our Environmental Defenders in Guinea-Bissau, West Africa who have been fighting to save the forests and defend the human rights of the citizens caught in this situation. In the past 18 months they have had amazing success and managed to ignite a national debate around illegal logging of Rosewood within the country that has lead to many positive outcomes.

1. Five Year Moratorium on the cutting and export of rosewood.

2. The Creation of a Government 'Illegal Logging Task Force Team'

3. The UN has debated the issue at the UN Security Council in Washington and amended the mandate to Guinea-Bissau to defend natural resources from devastation through organised crime.

This was achieved by their fearless reporting and wide engagement of citizens of all backgrounds throughout the country. Targeted research and sharing information through broadcasting on the national radio, with public phone-ins have been the key to their success.

The newly elected government just implemented a 5 year moratorium on logging and export of logs and timber, so they can have time to reform the sector but crucially protect the nations forests. Without their radio programs broadcasting crucial information at critical times we are sure the outcome of this situation would not have been so positive.

However the work is not finished; cutting and smuggling of logs out of the country continues. The Government now has an' Illegal Logging Task Force Team' in place. However they have asked NotOneMore's Bissau-Guinean partners to continue the radio programs as they are vital to providing live intelligence on were illegal logging and smuggling is happening.

Through supporting NotOneMore you are directly assisting our Bissau-Guinean Environmental Defenders and the Government 'Illegal Logging Task Force Team' and ultimatly AND MOST IMPORTANTLY the citzens of Guinea-Bissau who are having their forest stolen.

What We Need

-To Run 16 National Radio Programs

-A Vehicle to get to Communities and Report acts of Theft of Trees, Intimidation and Violence perpetrated to the Government of Guinea-Bissau

-To Run an Open Public meeting, Music Evening and Broadcast all

 

Radio Programs:

  • Broadcast for one and half hours is £415 or £4.61 per minute

  • We support a journalist to work two days to collect reports and interviews that is £130

  • We invite people from throughout the country to take part in the live radio shows this is £90 in expenses for two people

    Apart from the Journalist everyone donates their time for free to this.

    Vehicle:

    We have been asked by the Government Task Force Team to review their work independently in the communities. We must collect evidence of theft and human rights abuses suffered. We will compare our findings with the government findings and then verify that if compensation from the state becomes a reality that it gets those who have suffered. Communities have been afraid to ‘talk’ with the ‘Government’ this is why they have asked our Bissau-Guinean partners to review their work. However to do this a vehicle is required to get around the country as many villages are remote. Our partners have secured funding to complete this work but did not receive funding for a vehicle.

    £1500 to purchase a second-hand vehicle.

    £450 shipping costs

    £550 import taxes

  • Buying a vehicle in counrty is not an option it would be twice this amount.

    Public Meeting and Music Event:

    The radio shows have 30 minutes dedicated to public phones-in's but the lines are always jammed, people always have so much to say about what they see or have suffered. Telling the nation ensures that other citizens and the government hear what has happened in the remote areas.

    To offer a day were people can come and air their grievances fully to the Government Task Force Team in person. The radio station will broadcast this day as a program.

    The music event is to add an extra incentive to get people to travel to the capital and crucially we are looking for the youth of Guinea-Bissau to attend.

    If the full funding goals are not reached the radio programs will be prioritised to be broadcast first, with the support to the journalist and then the guests. The next priority will be a vehicle as the work they have have been asked to do is crucial in getting justice  and possibly compensation for those citizens who have suffered. The last priority would be the public meeting and music event.

The Impact

Is keeping this issue front and centre of the Governments agenda and ensuring to bring compensation and bring justice to their citizens.

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Right now in Guinea-Bissau the illegal loggers who left once the ban came into place have left behind millions of dollars’ worth of valuable logs.
  • That wealth must not be mis-managed by the Government and should be returned to the rural populations who have had their lands and forests destroyed.
  • For now the Government is being proactive and seeking our partners advice and expertise. They know that the radio shows made this issue a national priority and helped them understand what the country was facing.
  • A positive outcome would greatly benefit many citizens.
  • The Government is aware of how useful the radio programs are to the Task Force Team, however having suffered a military coup d’état 3 years ago and just being a newly re-instated government the state funds are extremely limited, hence why we have been asked to assist.

Risks & Challenges

We are applying for funding from other streams.

Telling peole through talks and events about our funding needs.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    We appreciate so much your interest in organisation and our partners in Guinea-Bissau.
    If you are not able to donate we really understand, all we ask is if you have the time please share our page and tell you friends and family about us, help us spread the word and hopefully we can help Guinea-Bissau to stop all illegal logging and safeguard the future of the forests.

story:
In communities across the U.S., people are looking for a way to get rid of their old stuff without throwing it in the trash. It can be difficult and time consuming to donate and recycle all that stuff responsibly. Many opt to donate everything to one location to save time. It gets the items out of their hands. But are those items really put to the best use, or used at all?

That’s where Aliyuzi Repurpose and Recycling comes in. We are here to reduce the amount of waste going into landfills. We are working towards a greener world by making sure that goods are reused or recycled in the most responsible way by reaching out into the community to make it easier for others to reduce and recycle too.


What we do

We pick up reusable goods that a person, organization, or business can’t use any more. We ensure that every item goes where it will do the most good. For example, we’ve given pet bedding to animal shelters and vet clinics, food to organizations that feed the hungry, and either reused or recycled old electronics, books, toys and housewares. We’ve already saved more than ½ ton of goods from the landfill.

What we need

Our current location and equipment doesn’t allow for everything we envision. With $5,000, we can buy a used pickup truck, giving us the ability to move both large items and a greater number of smaller items. With $10,000 or more, we can move into an appropriate warehouse space, expanding our capacity to serve Missoula and the surrounding communities on a larger scale.

Want to help?

Help us to help us all. Every contribution will get us a little bit closer to our goal. Even a few dollars will make a difference.

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially, but your support matters, too! You can still partner with us by sharing our story with your friends, both in-person and through social media.

Thanks so much for all you do.

story:
As a native of Southern California currently living in the Houston area, I know how precious clean water can be and how vast and under utilized the ocean is as a potential resource.

  • This campaign is to help get my concept realized for solar-powered floating water distillation units that don't disrupt any ecological systems or cause pollution to function.
  • Getting this project off the ground can help mediate the water shortage issues experienced anywhere there is ocean access in the long term.

What We Need & What You Get

  • This is for preliminary design, engineering and prototype manufacturing.
  • This unique concept uses small scale boat-like structures for large scale benefit.
  • If our goal is not met, we still use the funds to get as far as possible with the initial concept development.

The Impact

  • Instead of traditional desalinization which requires a lot of energy and heat, the idea is that these units will use solar energy to the same result.
  • Common-sense solution to a very common global problem based in real-life ingenuity!

Risks & Challenges

  • There may not be enough profit in selling water to fund large scale development or justify a for profit business.  However, if funds can be raised to develop the equipment, then the idea can be fully realized and shared to get these units built and distributed to any in-need area.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word if about this idea and campaign if you can't donate!

story:
Our cats were murdered by our local animal control officer, we believe out of retaliation because I filed a tort claim against him.  We run a no kill cat shelter and have some unethical figures of authority in our county that feel they can bully people and you are not allowed to stand up to them.  I am not the type of person to allow my civil rights to be trampled on.  This is a very, very long story, but this is the jest of it.........

My husband and I were charged for the deaths of Pumpkin, Sagwa, Garfield and Abbigayle.  Our rescue was raided on November 17, 2011.   We did not cause these cats to die.  The cats were fine in our care. I had, between November 7 and November 16, 2011, been to the vet with 1 cat that had surgery, 1 cat an exam and 1 cat that had come down with an upper respiratory infection.  On November 16, 2011 after speaking to the vet about preventing this URI from spreading to the other cats she provided me more medication and suggested I order L Lysine for all of the cats which was not in stock.  I ordered it and it came in the day after the raid.  The cats were under a vets care for the URI since the day before the raid, they were being cared for, vetted and  were not emaciated.  As a matter of fact the ACO testified during the trial that I did give him medication for the cats that had an upper respiratory infection and that he chose not to give it to them.  The animal control vet testified that he in fact prescribed medication to replace my vet's medication I provided animal control with.  The vet further testified that the ACO failed to pick up this medication for 4 days, the paperwork shows the first dose of medication given was given the day AFTER the state vet examined the animals, which was 11/21/11.  So the cats that had/were exhibiting signs of an upper respiratory infection went without much needed medication for 5 days and none of the cats received L Lysine at all.  This is according to paperwork from animal control and the testimony during the trial.  Anyone with cats that knows what an URI can do knows that if a cat can't breathe they will not eat, if a cat won't eat they can die if left without necessary treatment.

Pumpkin was a 7 week old kitten that died in her cage (with her siblings)  9 days after she was removed from our care.  We were charged with her death.

Sagwa was a beloved cat belonging to my then 14 year old son Parker.  She had a seizure while in animal controls care, the person in charge of these cats care called the aco and the vet who told her if Sagwa continues to seize for more than 30 minutes to euthanize her.  So Sagwa was murdered, they did not bother to take her to the vet which was 10 minutes away, nor have the vet come examine her.  Chances are if Sagwa had an injection of Valium she'd be alive today.  Sagwa never had any health problems the 7 years we had her.  Sagwa was murdered 11 days after being removed from our care.  We were charged with her death.

Garfield also belonged to Parker.  Garfield was fine in our care, he was alert, he was laying in the window when animal control arrived.  The record states that Garfield,  12 days after being removed from our care,  had labored breathing, blood tinged pus coming from his mouth and instead of taking him to the vet or having the vet come examine him, they euthanized him.  We were charged with his death.

Abbigayle was one of our adoption cats.  27 days after she was removed from our care she died from being starved to death for 8 days.  This is not what what think or assume, this is actual documentation from animal control.  We were charged with her death.

We demanded a jury trial because we are innocent, we did not do this, nor would we ever.  We love animals especially our own.  We knew we could prove our innocence as their evidence against us lays out pretty much how these cats died and who was at fault. However we did not receive a fair trial and were found guilty of child neglect and found guilty on each of the 4 cats for animal neglect, the charges on the cats was failure to provide reasonable care and failure to provide veterinary care.  However, the cats were reasonably cared for in our care and I provided animal control with medication the cats were on, and had been provided veterinary care.

The reasons we feel we did not receive a fair trial.....

1) For nearly 2 years we had the same judge, then 1 week before the trial we got another judge, which oddly enough was the same judge that caused me to file the tort claim to begin with.  Our attorneys filed a Motion to Recuse and she refused to do so twice.    This was a conflict of interest.  Not a small one either. This was not us going in front of this judge for a traffic ticket or something minor.    Her excuse was that she did not remember the case.  Even attorneys that have become judges won't take a case that they were once counsel to as it is a conflict of interest.

2) We do not feel the charges are even valid.  The reasons...1) the aco called in an exigent warrant on my black lab his exact words "I can see his spine and ribs from a distance".  However, I fought for my animals and the very same dog;  Coal got sick in their care, the judge (not the superior court judge) ordered the aco to take Coal to my vet, my vet wanted Coal to be seen by a specialist and during this visit with the specialist the ACO  told the vet "when I received the dog I'd say he was of average weight".  I have this on audio recording that Parker thought would  be helpful to me for the animals attorney, so we could remember exactly what the vet said was wrong with Coal, his prognoses, etc.   Then during the trial the State Vet testified that Coal was in fact of average weight.   She stated through her examination all 3 dogs were of average weight.   So why were we not charged with Coal's alleged emaciation?  This exigent warrant happened 3 hours before they got a warrant to enter our house.  They charged us on cats that were fine in our care, even took one that had sutures still from a $200 surgery, took one that I provided medication for from my vet that week, but yet we were not charged with a dog that the aco called in an exigent warrant on claiming the dog was skin and bones.

3)For months my attorney said he has asked the prosecutor if there were anymore intake photos as I did not receive them all.  He assured my attorney that all the discovery had been sent to him and my husbands attorney.  This is the same prosecutor that told the judge during a hearing when I told the judge I had not received any intake photos that there were no photos.  The judge asked me why I thought there were intake photos.  I told the judge the prosecutor told me there were 2 disks.  However the prosecutor laughed it off trying to make me look stupid.  The judge told him to look and see if there were any photos.  I did end up later getting 1 disk with some pictures of the cats, no dogs or chickens.  During the trial the prosecutor sprung these extra photos of the cats (still no photos of the dogs or the chickens) that WERE NOT part of the pre trial discover.  Both our attorneys objected to them being entered.  The judge allowed them to be entered because the prosecutor said they were given to me, in which they weren't.

 4) There are no intake photos of Pumpkin and there are no photos of any dead cats to prove these cats actually died.

5) BOTH the vet for animal control AND the State Vet testified in court when asked if they can say I or my husband had anything to do to cause the cats deaths BOTH said no.

6) My vet bills were not allowed to be used as my defense because the prosecutor objected.  When the lawyers spoke with the judge the judge refused to allow them, her reason was "because the defense attorneys should had entered them into evidence as business documents before the trial." 

7) The fact that the State Vet examined all the animals on November 21, 2011 and scored ALL the cats under a body condition score of a 4, most of them scoring a 1-2.  This includes the 2 cats I got the evening before the raid.  So if these cats were so underweight why was the person that I feel was the "set up" not charged as well? Both her cats scored a 3 and I think a 2.

8) The child neglect charges are based on opinions from the deputy that I made my 14 year old son and 17 year old daughter to sleep in my 19 year old sons bed.  However, my house was a mess because I moved my 19 year old son out of his bedroom which was in the the basement because it had flooded.  Why on earth would I move 1 kid to the living room and make my 2 other children sleep in his bed when they have their own bedrooms?  Not to mention, both the aco and the deputy testified as to where Parker and Candace's bedrooms were.  No one used the basement since the first week of October of that year, we had to empty out a full size basement, it had to go to the main floor and to the loft.  What items could go in the shed went into the shed.  We lost a whole floor that was used as a bedroom and storage, emptying a full size basement with a bunch of wet and dirty items is not something that can be done in a day especially with 3 kids in school, a husband with a full time job and me with a physical disability.  To prevent it being overwhelming we did it on weekends and I and the kids would finish cleaning things and finding a place for them to go during the week.

I will add the rest as I can but you get the idea.

So now, we are coming to the end of appeal phase, and have to take a final appeal to the Supreme Court, after that is our plea for post conviction relief.  We have to raise $23,000 for a private attorney to go forth for post conviction relief.  The sole reason we are doing this is to get justice for our children and our animals.  Our kids have been put through hell because of the system, not because of us.  And our animals were abused while in animal controls care.  State law says you are to vet an animal that is ill, I did that, the ACO did not and testified to that.  If we ever get the conviction overturned and are acquitted  we then can seek justice for all the cats that died in Animal Controls care, that would be Pumpkin, Sagwa, Garfield, Abbigayle, Izzie and Kitler as well as Parkers rooster Zim.  We need to get justice for the abuse and neglect these animals suffered while we fought 2 years to get them home.

If you have further questions please ask me or look at our website.  I know some of you will see the truth and will become furious as to what happened.  While others will be oblivious to the truth and support a corrupt system and that is your choice.  However, we are innocent and are simply asking to have the ENTIRE truth be told in an honest court of law, by competent representation.  To achieve that we need help.  We have to raise $23,000 to hire a private attorney, we cannot afford to put our lives in the hands of another public defender for this last leg of hope.  Our first hurdle is raising $3000 in a short time frame.  This is a must to get these parties going on this, we don't have very long.

We are having auctions and selling what we can to raise this money, but if you can donate just $1 to see our kids and cats get justice we appreciate it.

Thank you,
Samantha, Randell, Joshua, Candace and Parker
We all are animal lovers, we are against animal abuse and we want justice and the right person charged with the mental abuse  placed upon our children and the physical abuse and neglect our animals endured.
